BarcodeQRCode setHints	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsetHints\npublic void setHints(Map<EncodeHintType,Object> hints)\n\nParameters:\nhints - modifiers to change the way the barcode is created. They can be EncodeHintType.ERROR_CORRECTION\n              and EncodeHintType.CHARACTER_SET. For EncodeHintType.ERROR_CORRECTION the values can be ErrorCorrectionLevel.L, M, Q, H.\n              For EncodeHintType.CHARACTER_SET the values are strings and can be Cp437, Shift_JIS and ISO-8859-1 to ISO-8859-16.\n              You can also use UTF-8, but correct behaviour is not guaranteed as Unicode is not supported in QRCodes.\n              The default value is ISO-8859-1.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/BarcodeQRCode.html

BlockElement setSpacingRatio	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsetSpacingRatio\npublic T setSpacingRatio(float ratio)\nSets a ratio which determines in which proportion will word spacing and character spacing\n be applied when horizontal alignment is justified.\n\nParameters:\nratio - the ratio coefficient. It must be between 0 and 1, inclusive.\n              It means that ratio part of the free space will\n              be compensated by word spacing, and 1-ratio part of the free space will\n              be compensated by character spacing.\n              If ratio is 1, additional character spacing will not be applied.\n              If ratio is 0, additional word spacing will not be applied.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/BlockElement.html

BlockElement	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A BlockElement will try to take up as much horizontal space as\n available to it on the canvas or page. The concept is comparable to the block\n element in HTML. Also like in HTML, the visual representation of the object\n can be delimited by padding, a border, and/or a margin.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/BlockElement.html

Border draw	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ndraw\npublic abstract void draw(PdfCanvas canvas,\n                          float x1,\n                          float y1,\n                          float x2,\n                          float y2,\n                          float borderWidthBefore,\n                          float borderWidthAfter)\n\n All borders are supposed to be drawn in such way, that inner content of the element is on the right from the\n drawing direction. Borders are drawn in this order: top, right, bottom, left.\n \n\n Given points specify the line which lies on the border of the content area,\n therefore the border itself should be drawn to the left from the drawing direction.\n \n\nborderWidthBefore and borderWidthAfter parameters are used to\n define the widths of the borders that are before and after the current border, e.g. for\n the bottom border, borderWidthBefore specifies width of the right border and\n borderWidthAfter - width of the left border. Those width are used to handle areas\n of border joins.\n \n\nParameters:\ncanvas - PdfCanvas to be written to\nx1 - x coordinate of the beginning point of the element side, that should be bordered\ny1 - y coordinate of the beginning point of the element side, that should be bordered\nx2 - x coordinate of the ending point of the element side, that should be bordered\ny2 - y coordinate of the ending point of the element side, that should be bordered\nborderWidthBefore - defines width of the border that is before the current one\nborderWidthAfter - defines width of the border that is after the current one\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/Border.html

Canvas close	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nclose\npublic void close()\nCloses the Canvas. Although not completely necessary in all cases, it is still recommended to call this\n method when you are done working with Canvas object, as due to some properties set there might be some\n 'hanging' elements, which are waiting other elements to be added and processed. close() tells the\n Canvas that no more elements will be added and it is time to finish processing all the elements.\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/Canvas.html

CanvasTag	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This class represents a single tag on a single piece of marked content.\n\n \n In Tagged PDF, a tag is the basic structure unit for marking content. The tag\n structure and hierarchy is largely comparable to HTML. As in HTML, every tag\n type has a name, defined here in the role attribute. CFFFontSubset	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This Class subsets a CFF Type Font. The subset is preformed for CID fonts and NON CID fonts.\n The Charstring is subsetted for both types. For CID fonts only the FDArray which are used are embedded.\n The Lsubroutines of the FDArrays used are subsetted as well. The Subroutine subset supports both Type1 and Type2\n formatting although only tested on Type2 Format.\n For Non CID the Lsubroutines are subsetted. On both types the Gsubroutines is subsetted.\n A font which was not of CID type is transformed into CID as a part of the subset process.\n The CID synthetic creation was written by Sivan Toledo (sivan@math.tau.ac.il)</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/CFFFontSubset.html

CompareTool compareByCatalog	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ncompareByCatalog\npublic CompareTool.CompareResult compareByCatalog(PdfDocument outDocument,\n                                                  PdfDocument cmpDocument)\n                                           throws IOException\nCompares two PDF documents by content starting from Catalog dictionary and then recursively comparing\n corresponding objects which are referenced from it. You can roughly imagine it as depth-first traversal\n of the two trees that represent pdf objects structure of the documents.\n \n The main difference between this method and the compareByContent(String, String, String, String)\n methods is the return value. This method returns a CompareTool.CompareResult class instance, which could be used\n in code, however compareByContent methods in case of the differences simply return String value, which could\n only be printed. Also, keep in mind that this method doesn't perform visual comparison of the documents.\n \n For more explanations about what is outDoc and cmpDoc see last paragraph of the CompareTool\n class description.\n\nParameters:\noutDocument - the absolute path to the output file, which is to be compared to cmp-file.\ncmpDocument - the absolute path to the cmp-file, which is to be compared to output file.\nReturns:\nthe report of comparison of two files in the form of the custom class instance.\n See CompareTool.CompareResult for more info.\nThrows:\nIOException\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/CompareTool.html
CompareTool disableCachedPagesComparison	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ndisableCachedPagesComparison\npublic CompareTool disableCachedPagesComparison()\nDisables the default logic of pages comparison.\n This option makes sense only for compareByCatalog(PdfDocument, PdfDocument) method.\n \n By default, pages are treated as special objects and if they are met in the process of comparison, then they are\n not checked as objects, but rather simply checked that they has same page numbers in both documents.\n This behaviour is intended for the compareByContent(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String)\n set of methods, because in them documents are compared in page by page basis. Thus, we don't need to check if pages\n are of the same content when they are met in comparison process, we are sure that we will compare their content or\n we have already compared them.\n \n However, if you would use compareByCatalog(com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument, com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument) with default behaviour\n of pages comparison, pages won't be checked at all, every time when reference to the page dictionary is met,\n only page numbers will be compared for both documents. You can say that in this case, comparison will be performed\n for all document's catalog entries except /Pages (However in fact, document's page tree structures will be compared,\n but pages themselves - won't).\n\nReturns:\nthis CompareTool instance.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/CompareTool.html
CompareTool setCompareByContentErrorsLimit	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsetCompareByContentErrorsLimit\npublic CompareTool setCompareByContentErrorsLimit(int compareByContentMaxErrorCount)\nSets the maximum errors count which will be returned as the result of the comparison.\n\nParameters:\ncompareByContentMaxErrorCount - the errors count.\nReturns:\nthis CompareTool instance.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/CompareTool.html
CompareTool setGenerateCompareByContentXmlReport	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsetGenerateCompareByContentXmlReport\npublic CompareTool setGenerateCompareByContentXmlReport(boolean generateCompareByContentXmlReport)\nEnables or disables the generation of the comparison report in the form of the xml document.\n \n IMPORTANT NOTE: this flag affect only the comparison made by compareByContent methods!\n\nParameters:\ngenerateCompareByContentXmlReport - true to enable xml report generation, false - to disable.\nReturns:\nthis CompareTool instance.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/CompareTool.html
CompareTool enableEncryptionCompare	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nenableEncryptionCompare\npublic CompareTool enableEncryptionCompare()\nEnables the comparison of the encryption properties of the documents. Encryption properties comparison\n results are returned along with all other comparison results.\n \n IMPORTANT NOTE: this flag affect only the comparison made by compareByContent methods!\n\nReturns:\nthis CompareTool instance.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/CompareTool.html
CompareTool getOutReaderProperties	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ngetOutReaderProperties\npublic ReaderProperties getOutReaderProperties()\nDocuments for comparison are opened in reader mode. This method is intended to alter ReaderProperties\n which are used to open output document. This is particularly useful for comparison of encrypted documents.\n \n For more explanations about what is outDoc and cmpDoc see last paragraph of the CompareTool\n class description.\n\nReturns:\nReaderProperties instance which will be later passed to the output document PdfReader.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/CompareTool.html
CompareTool getCmpReaderProperties	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ngetCmpReaderProperties\npublic ReaderProperties getCmpReaderProperties()\nDocuments for comparison are opened in reader mode. This method is intended to alter ReaderProperties\n which are used to open cmp document. This is particularly useful for comparison of encrypted documents.\n \n For more explanations about what is outDoc and cmpDoc see last paragraph of the CompareTool\n class description.\n\nReturns:\nReaderProperties instance which will be later passed to the cmp document PdfReader.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/CompareTool.html
CompareTool compareVisually	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ncompareVisually\npublic String compareVisually(String outPdf,\n                              String cmpPdf,\n                              String outPath,\n                              String differenceImagePrefix)\n                       throws InterruptedException,\n                              IOException\nCompares two documents visually. For the comparison two external tools are used: Ghostscript and ImageMagick.\n For more info about needed configuration for visual comparison process see CompareTool class description.\n \n During comparison for every page of two documents an image file will be created in the folder specified by\n outPath absolute path. Then those page images will be compared and if there are any differences for some pages,\n another image file will be created with marked differences on it.\n\nParameters:\noutPdf - the absolute path to the output file, which is to be compared to cmp-file.\ncmpPdf - the absolute path to the cmp-file, which is to be compared to output file.\noutPath - the absolute path to the folder, which will be used to store image files for visual comparison.\ndifferenceImagePrefix - file name prefix for image files with marked differences if there is any.\nReturns:\nstring containing list of the pages that are visually different, or null if there are no visual differences.\nThrows:\nInterruptedException\nIOException\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/CompareTool.html
CompareTool compareVisually	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ncompareVisually\npublic String compareVisually(String outPdf,\n                              String cmpPdf,\n                              String outPath,\n                              String differenceImagePrefix,\n                              Map<Integer,List<Rectangle>> ignoredAreas)\n                       throws InterruptedException,\n                              IOException\nCompares two documents visually. For the comparison two external tools are used: Ghostscript and ImageMagick.\n For more info about needed configuration for visual comparison process see CompareTool class description.\n \n During comparison for every page of two documents an image file will be created in the folder specified by\n outPath absolute path. Then those page images will be compared and if there are any differences for some pages,\n another image file will be created with marked differences on it.\n \n It is possible to ignore certain areas of the document pages during visual comparison. This is useful for example\n in case if documents should be the same except certain page area with date on it. In this case, in the folder\n specified by the outPath, new pdf documents will be created with the black rectangles at the specified ignored\n areas, and visual comparison will be performed on these new documents.\n\nParameters:\noutPdf - the absolute path to the output file, which is to be compared to cmp-file.\ncmpPdf - the absolute path to the cmp-file, which is to be compared to output file.\noutPath - the absolute path to the folder, which will be used to store image files for visual comparison.\ndifferenceImagePrefix - file name prefix for image files with marked differences if there is any.\nignoredAreas - a map with one-based page numbers as keys and lists of ignored rectangles as values.\nReturns:\nstring containing list of the pages that are visually different, or null if there are no visual differences.\nThrows:\nInterruptedException\nIOException\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/CompareTool.html
CompareTool compareByContent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ncompareByContent\npublic String compareByContent(String outPdf,\n                               String cmpPdf,\n                               String outPath,\n                               String differenceImagePrefix)\n                        throws InterruptedException,\n                               IOException\nCompares two PDF documents by content starting from page dictionaries and then recursively comparing\n corresponding objects which are referenced from them. You can roughly imagine it as depth-first traversal\n of the two trees that represent pdf objects structure of the documents.\n \n Unlike compareByCatalog(PdfDocument, PdfDocument) this method performs content comparison page by page\n and doesn't compare the tag structure, acroforms and all other things that doesn't belong to specific pages.\n \n When comparison by content is finished, if any differences were found, visual comparison is automatically started.\n For more info see compareVisually(String, String, String, String).\n \n For more explanations about what is outPdf and cmpPdf see last paragraph of the CompareTool\n class description.\n\nParameters:\noutPdf - the absolute path to the output file, which is to be compared to cmp-file.\ncmpPdf - the absolute path to the cmp-file, which is to be compared to output file.\noutPath - the absolute path to the folder, which will be used to store image files for visual comparison.\ndifferenceImagePrefix - file name prefix for image files with marked visual differences if there is any.\nReturns:\nstring containing text report of the encountered content differences and also list of the pages that are\n visually different, or null if there are no content and therefore no visual differences.\nThrows:\nInterruptedException\nIOException\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/CompareTool.html
CompareTool compareByContent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ncompareByContent\npublic String compareByContent(String outPdf,\n                               String cmpPdf,\n                               String outPath,\n                               String differenceImagePrefix,\n                               byte[] outPass,\n                               byte[] cmpPass)\n                        throws InterruptedException,\n                               IOException\nThis method overload is used to compare two encrypted PDF documents. Document passwords are passed with\n outPass and cmpPass parameters.\n \n Compares two PDF documents by content starting from page dictionaries and then recursively comparing\n corresponding objects which are referenced from them. You can roughly imagine it as depth-first traversal\n of the two trees that represent pdf objects structure of the documents.\n \n Unlike compareByCatalog(PdfDocument, PdfDocument) this method performs content comparison page by page\n and doesn't compare the tag structure, acroforms and all other things that doesn't belong to specific pages.\n \n When comparison by content is finished, if any differences were found, visual comparison is automatically started.\n For more info see compareVisually(String, String, String, String).\n \n For more explanations about what is outPdf and cmpPdf see last paragraph of the CompareTool\n class description.\n\nParameters:\noutPdf - the absolute path to the output file, which is to be compared to cmp-file.\ncmpPdf - the absolute path to the cmp-file, which is to be compared to output file.\noutPath - the absolute path to the folder, which will be used to store image files for visual comparison.\ndifferenceImagePrefix - file name prefix for image files with marked visual differences if there is any.\noutPass - password for the encrypted document specified by the outPdf absolute path.\ncmpPass - password for the encrypted document specified by the cmpPdf absolute path.\nReturns:\nstring containing text report of the encountered content differences and also list of the pages that are\n visually different, or null if there are no content and therefore no visual differences.\nThrows:\nInterruptedException\nIOException\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/CompareTool.html
CompareTool compareByContent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ncompareByContent\npublic String compareByContent(String outPdf,\n                               String cmpPdf,\n                               String outPath,\n                               String differenceImagePrefix,\n                               Map<Integer,List<Rectangle>> ignoredAreas)\n                        throws InterruptedException,\n                               IOException\nCompares two PDF documents by content starting from page dictionaries and then recursively comparing\n corresponding objects which are referenced from them. You can roughly imagine it as depth-first traversal\n of the two trees that represent pdf objects structure of the documents.\n \n Unlike compareByCatalog(PdfDocument, PdfDocument) this method performs content comparison page by page\n and doesn't compare the tag structure, acroforms and all other things that doesn't belong to specific pages.\n \n When comparison by content is finished, if any differences were found, visual comparison is automatically started.\n For more info see compareVisually(String, String, String, String, Map).\n \n For more explanations about what is outPdf and cmpPdf see last paragraph of the CompareTool\n class description.\n\nParameters:\noutPdf - the absolute path to the output file, which is to be compared to cmp-file.\ncmpPdf - the absolute path to the cmp-file, which is to be compared to output file.\noutPath - the absolute path to the folder, which will be used to store image files for visual comparison.\ndifferenceImagePrefix - file name prefix for image files with marked visual differences if there is any.\nignoredAreas - a map with one-based page numbers as keys and lists of ignored rectangles as values.\nReturns:\nstring containing text report of the encountered content differences and also list of the pages that are\n visually different, or null if there are no content and therefore no visual differences.\nThrows:\nInterruptedException\nIOException\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/CompareTool.html
CompareTool compareByContent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ncompareByContent\npublic String compareByContent(String outPdf,\n                               String cmpPdf,\n                               String outPath,\n                               String differenceImagePrefix,\n                               Map<Integer,List<Rectangle>> ignoredAreas,\n                               byte[] outPass,\n                               byte[] cmpPass)\n                        throws InterruptedException,\n                               IOException\nThis method overload is used to compare two encrypted PDF documents. Document passwords are passed with\n outPass and cmpPass parameters.\n \n Compares two PDF documents by content starting from page dictionaries and then recursively comparing\n corresponding objects which are referenced from them. You can roughly imagine it as depth-first traversal\n of the two trees that represent pdf objects structure of the documents.\n \n Unlike compareByCatalog(PdfDocument, PdfDocument) this method performs content comparison page by page\n and doesn't compare the tag structure, acroforms and all other things that doesn't belong to specific pages.\n \n When comparison by content is finished, if any differences were found, visual comparison is automatically started.\n For more info see compareVisually(String, String, String, String, Map).\n \n For more explanations about what is outPdf and cmpPdf see last paragraph of the CompareTool\n class description.\n\nParameters:\noutPdf - the absolute path to the output file, which is to be compared to cmp-file.\ncmpPdf - the absolute path to the cmp-file, which is to be compared to output file.\noutPath - the absolute path to the folder, which will be used to store image files for visual comparison.\ndifferenceImagePrefix - file name prefix for image files with marked visual differences if there is any.\nignoredAreas - a map with one-based page numbers as keys and lists of ignored rectangles as values.\noutPass - password for the encrypted document specified by the outPdf absolute path.\ncmpPass - password for the encrypted document specified by the cmpPdf absolute path.\nReturns:\nstring containing text report of the encountered content differences and also list of the pages that are\n visually different, or null if there are no content and therefore no visual differences.\nThrows:\nInterruptedException\nIOException\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/CompareTool.html

CompareTool	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This class provides means to compare two PDF files both by content and visually\n and gives the report of their differences.\n \n For visual comparison it uses external tools: Ghostscript and ImageMagick, which\n should be installed on your machine. To allow CompareTool to use them, you need\n to pass either java properties or environment variables with names "gsExec" and\n "compareExec", which would contain the paths to the executables of correspondingly\n Ghostscript and ImageMagick tools.\n \n CompareTool class was mainly designed for the testing purposes of iText in order to\n ensure that the same code produces the same PDF document. For this reason you will\n often encounter such parameter names as "outDoc" and "cmpDoc" which stand for output\n document and document-for-comparison. The first one is viewed as the current result,\n and the second one is referred as normal or ideal result. OutDoc is compared to the\n ideal cmpDoc. Therefore all reports of the comparison are in the form: "Expected ...,\n but was ...". This should be interpreted in the following way: "expected" part stands\n for the content of the cmpDoc and "but was" part stands for the content of the outDoc.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/CompareTool.html

DashedBorder draw	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ndraw\npublic void draw(PdfCanvas canvas,\n                 float x1,\n                 float y1,\n                 float x2,\n                 float y2,\n                 float borderWidthBefore,\n                 float borderWidthAfter)\n\n All borders are supposed to be drawn in such way, that inner content of the element is on the right from the\n drawing direction. Borders are drawn in this order: top, right, bottom, left.\n \n\n Given points specify the line which lies on the border of the content area,\n therefore the border itself should be drawn to the left from the drawing direction.\n \n\nborderWidthBefore and borderWidthAfter parameters are used to\n define the widths of the borders that are before and after the current border, e.g. for\n the bottom border, borderWidthBefore specifies width of the right border and\n borderWidthAfter - width of the left border. Those width are used to handle areas\n of border joins.\n \n\nSpecified by:\ndraw in class Border\nParameters:\ncanvas - PdfCanvas to be written to\nx1 - x coordinate of the beginning point of the element side, that should be bordered\ny1 - y coordinate of the beginning point of the element side, that should be bordered\nx2 - x coordinate of the ending point of the element side, that should be bordered\ny2 - y coordinate of the ending point of the element side, that should be bordered\nborderWidthBefore - defines width of the border that is before the current one\nborderWidthAfter - defines width of the border that is after the current one\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/DashedBorder.html

Document	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Document is the default root element when creating a self-sufficient PDF. It\n mainly operates high-level operations e.g. setting page size and rotation,\n adding elements, and writing text at specific coordinates. It has no\n knowledge of the actual PDF concepts and syntax.\n \n A Document's rendering behavior can be modified by extending\n DocumentRenderer and setting an instance of this newly created with\n setRenderer(com.itextpdf.layout.renderer.DocumentRenderer).</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/Document.html
DoNothingFilter decode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ndecode\npublic byte[] decode(byte[] b,\n                     PdfName filterName,\n                     PdfObject decodeParams,\n                     PdfDictionary streamDictionary)\nDescription copied from interface: IFilterHandler\nDecode the byte[] using the provided filterName.\n\nSpecified by:\ndecode in interface IFilterHandler\nParameters:\nb - the bytes that need to be decoded\nfilterName - PdfName of the filter\ndecodeParams - decode parameters\nstreamDictionary - the dictionary of the stream. DottedBorder draw	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ndraw\npublic void draw(PdfCanvas canvas,\n                 float x1,\n                 float y1,\n                 float x2,\n                 float y2,\n                 float borderWidthBefore,\n                 float borderWidthAfter)\n\n All borders are supposed to be drawn in such way, that inner content of the element is on the right from the\n drawing direction. Borders are drawn in this order: top, right, bottom, left.\n \n\n Given points specify the line which lies on the border of the content area,\n therefore the border itself should be drawn to the left from the drawing direction.\n \n\nborderWidthBefore and borderWidthAfter parameters are used to\n define the widths of the borders that are before and after the current border, e.g. for\n the bottom border, borderWidthBefore specifies width of the right border and\n borderWidthAfter - width of the left border. Those width are used to handle areas\n of border joins.\n \n\nSpecified by:\ndraw in class Border\nParameters:\ncanvas - PdfCanvas to be written to\nx1 - x coordinate of the beginning point of the element side, that should be bordered\ny1 - y coordinate of the beginning point of the element side, that should be bordered\nx2 - x coordinate of the ending point of the element side, that should be bordered\ny2 - y coordinate of the ending point of the element side, that should be bordered\nborderWidthBefore - defines width of the border that is before the current one\nborderWidthAfter - defines width of the border that is after the current one\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/DottedBorder.html

ElementPropertyContainer setUnderline	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsetUnderline\npublic T setUnderline(Color color,\n                      float thickness,\n                      float thicknessMul,\n                      float yPosition,\n                      float yPositionMul,\n                      int lineCapStyle)\nSets an horizontal line that can be an underline or a strikethrough.\n Actually, the line can be anywhere vertically due to position parameter.\n Multiple call to this method will produce multiple lines.\n \n The thickness of the line will be thickness + thicknessMul * fontSize.\n The position of the line will be baseLine + yPosition + yPositionMul * fontSize.\n\nParameters:\ncolor - the color of the line or null to follow the\n                     text color\nthickness - the absolute thickness of the line\nthicknessMul - the thickness multiplication factor with the font size\nyPosition - the absolute y position relative to the baseline\nyPositionMul - the position multiplication factor with the font size\nlineCapStyle - the end line cap style. Allowed values are enumerated in\n                     PdfCanvasConstants.LineCapStyle\nReturns:\nthis element\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/ElementPropertyContainer.html

FilteredEventListener attachEventListener	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nattachEventListener\npublic <T extends IEventListener> T attachEventListener(T delegate,\n                                                        IEventFilter... filterSet)\nAttaches another IEventListener delegate with its filters.\n When all the filters attached to the delegate for an event accept the event, the event will be passed on to\n the delegate.\n You can attach multiple delegates to this FilteredEventListener instance. The content stream will\n be parsed just once, so it is better for performance than creating multiple FilteredEventListener\n instances and parsing the content stream multiple times. This is useful, for instance, when you want\n to extract content from multiple regions of a page.\n\nParameters:\ndelegate - a delegate that fill be called when all the corresponding filters for an event pass\nfilterSet - filters attached to the delegate that will be tested before passing an event on to the delegate\nReturns:\ndelegate that has been passed to the method, used for convenient call chaining\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/FilteredEventListener.html

FontProgramFactory createFont	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ncreateFont\npublic static FontProgram createFont()\n                              throws IOException\nCreates a new font. This will always be the default Helvetica font (not embedded).\n This method is introduced because Helvetica is used in many examples.\n\nReturns:\na BaseFont object (Helvetica, Winansi, not embedded)\nThrows:\nIOException\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/FontProgramFactory.html
FontProgramFactory createFont	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ncreateFont\npublic static FontProgram createFont(String fontProgram)\n                              throws IOException\nCreates a new font. This font can be one of the 14 built in types,\n a Type1 font referred to by an AFM or PFM file, a TrueType font (simple or collection) or a CJK font from the\n Adobe Asian Font Pack. TrueType fonts and CJK fonts can have an optional style modifier\n appended to the name. These modifiers are: Bold, Italic and BoldItalic. An\n example would be "STSong-Light,Bold". Note that this modifiers do not work if\n the font is embedded. Fonts in TrueType collections are addressed by index such as "msgothic.ttc,1".\n This would get the second font (indexes start at 0), in this case "MS PGothic".\n \n The fonts are cached and if they already exist they are extracted from the cache,\n not parsed again.\n \n Besides the common encodings described by name, custom encodings\n can also be made. These encodings will only work for the single byte fonts\n Type1 and TrueType. The encoding string starts with a '#'\n followed by "simple" or "full". If "simple" there is a decimal for the first character position and then a list\n of hex values representing the Unicode codes that compose that encoding.\n The "simple" encoding is recommended for TrueType fonts\n as the "full" encoding risks not matching the character with the right glyph\n if not done with care.\n The "full" encoding is specially aimed at Type1 fonts where the glyphs have to be\n described by non standard names like the Tex math fonts. Each group of three elements\n compose a code position: the one byte code order in decimal or as 'x' (x cannot be the space), the name and the Unicode character\n used to access the glyph. The space must be assigned to character position 32 otherwise\n text justification will not work.\n \n Example for a "simple" encoding that includes the Unicode\n character space, A, B and ecyrillic:\n \n "# simple 32 0020 0041 0042 0454"\n \n\n Example for a "full" encoding for a Type1 Tex font:\n \n "# full 'A' nottriangeqlleft 0041 'B' dividemultiply 0042 32 space 0020"\n \n\n This method calls:\n\n createFont(name, null, true);\n \n\nParameters:\nfontProgram - the name of the font or its location on file\nReturns:\nreturns a new font. This font may come from the cache\nThrows:\nIOException\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/FontProgramFactory.html
FontProgramFactory createFont	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ncreateFont\npublic static FontProgram createFont(String fontProgram,\n                                     boolean cached)\n                              throws IOException\nCreates a new font. This font can be one of the 14 built in types,\n a Type1 font referred to by an AFM or PFM file, a TrueType font (simple or collection) or a CJK font from the\n Adobe Asian Font Pack. TrueType fonts and CJK fonts can have an optional style modifier\n appended to the name. These modifiers are: Bold, Italic and BoldItalic. An\n example would be "STSong-Light,Bold". Note that this modifiers do not work if\n the font is embedded. Fonts in TrueType collections are addressed by index such as "msgothic.ttc,1".\n This would get the second font (indexes start at 0), in this case "MS PGothic".\n \n The fonts are cached and if they already exist they are extracted from the cache,\n not parsed again.\n \n Besides the common encodings described by name, custom encodings\n can also be made. These encodings will only work for the single byte fonts\n Type1 and TrueType. The encoding string starts with a '#'\n followed by "simple" or "full". If "simple" there is a decimal for the first character position and then a list\n of hex values representing the Unicode codes that compose that encoding.\n The "simple" encoding is recommended for TrueType fonts\n as the "full" encoding risks not matching the character with the right glyph\n if not done with care.\n The "full" encoding is specially aimed at Type1 fonts where the glyphs have to be\n described by non standard names like the Tex math fonts. Each group of three elements\n compose a code position: the one byte code order in decimal or as 'x' (x cannot be the space), the name and the Unicode character\n used to access the glyph. The space must be assigned to character position 32 otherwise\n text justification will not work.\n \n Example for a "simple" encoding that includes the Unicode\n character space, A, B and ecyrillic:\n \n "# simple 32 0020 0041 0042 0454"\n \n\n Example for a "full" encoding for a Type1 Tex font:\n \n "# full 'A' nottriangeqlleft 0041 'B' dividemultiply 0042 32 space 0020"\n \n\n This method calls:\n\n createFont(name, encoding, embedded, true, null, null);\n \n\nParameters:\nfontProgram - the name of the font or its location on file\ncached - true if the font comes from the cache or is added to\n                    the cache if new, false if the font is always created new\nReturns:\nreturns a new font. This font may come from the cache\nThrows:\nIOException\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/FontProgramFactory.html
FontProgramFactory createFont	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ncreateFont\npublic static FontProgram createFont(byte[] fontProgram)\n                              throws IOException\nCreates a new font. This font can be one of the 14 built in types,\n a Type1 font referred to by an AFM or PFM file, a TrueType font (simple or collection) or a CJK font from the\n Adobe Asian Font Pack. TrueType fonts and CJK fonts can have an optional style modifier\n appended to the name. These modifiers are: Bold, Italic and BoldItalic. An\n example would be "STSong-Light,Bold". Note that this modifiers do not work if\n the font is embedded. Fonts in TrueType collections are addressed by index such as "msgothic.ttc,1".\n This would get the second font (indexes start at 0), in this case "MS PGothic".\n \n Besides the common encodings described by name, custom encodings\n can also be made. These encodings will only work for the single byte fonts\n Type1 and TrueType. The encoding string starts with a '#'\n followed by "simple" or "full". If "simple" there is a decimal for the first character position and then a list\n of hex values representing the Unicode codes that compose that encoding.\n The "simple" encoding is recommended for TrueType fonts\n as the "full" encoding risks not matching the character with the right glyph\n if not done with care.\n The "full" encoding is specially aimed at Type1 fonts where the glyphs have to be\n described by non standard names like the Tex math fonts. Each group of three elements\n compose a code position: the one byte code order in decimal or as 'x' (x cannot be the space), the name and the Unicode character\n used to access the glyph. The space must be assigned to character position 32 otherwise\n text justification will not work.\n \n Example for a "simple" encoding that includes the Unicode\n character space, A, B and ecyrillic:\n \n "# simple 32 0020 0041 0042 0454"\n \n\n Example for a "full" encoding for a Type1 Tex font:\n \n "# full 'A' nottriangeqlleft 0041 'B' dividemultiply 0042 32 space 0020"\n \n\nParameters:\nfontProgram - the true type font or the afm in a byte array\n                    an exception if the font is not recognized. Note that even if true an exception may be thrown in some circumstances.\n                    This parameter is useful for FontProgramFactory that may have to check many invalid font names before finding the right one\nReturns:\nreturns a new font. This font may come from the cache but only if cached\n is true, otherwise it will always be created new\nThrows:\nIOException\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/FontProgramFactory.html
FontProgramFactory createFont	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ncreateFont\npublic static FontProgram createFont(String name,\n                                     byte[] font,\n                                     boolean cached)\n                              throws IOException\nCreates a new font. This font can be one of the 14 built in types,\n a Type1 font referred to by an AFM or PFM file, a TrueType font (simple or collection) or a CJK font from the\n Adobe Asian Font Pack. TrueType fonts and CJK fonts can have an optional style modifier\n appended to the name. These modifiers are: Bold, Italic and BoldItalic. An\n example would be "STSong-Light,Bold". Note that this modifiers do not work if\n the font is embedded. Fonts in TrueType collections are addressed by index such as "msgothic.ttc,1".\n This would get the second font (indexes start at 0), in this case "MS PGothic".\n \n The fonts may or may not be cached depending on the flag cached.\n If the byte arrays are present the font will be\n read from them instead of the name. A name is still required to identify\n the font type.\n \n Besides the common encodings described by name, custom encodings\n can also be made. These encodings will only work for the single byte fonts\n Type1 and TrueType. The encoding string starts with a '#'\n followed by "simple" or "full". If "simple" there is a decimal for the first character position and then a list\n of hex values representing the Unicode codes that compose that encoding.\n The "simple" encoding is recommended for TrueType fonts\n as the "full" encoding risks not matching the character with the right glyph\n if not done with care.\n The "full" encoding is specially aimed at Type1 fonts where the glyphs have to be\n described by non standard names like the Tex math fonts. Each group of three elements\n compose a code position: the one byte code order in decimal or as 'x' (x cannot be the space), the name and the Unicode character\n used to access the glyph. The space must be assigned to character position 32 otherwise\n text justification will not work.\n \n Example for a "simple" encoding that includes the Unicode\n character space, A, B and ecyrillic:\n \n "# simple 32 0020 0041 0042 0454"\n \n\n Example for a "full" encoding for a Type1 Tex font:\n \n "# full 'A' nottriangeqlleft 0041 'B' dividemultiply 0042 32 space 0020"\n \n\nParameters:\nname - the name of the font or its location on file\nfont - the true type font or the afm in a byte array\ncached - true if the font comes from the cache or is added to\n               the cache if new, false if the font is always created new\nReturns:\nreturns a new font. This font may come from the cache but only if cached\n is true, otherwise it will always be created new\nThrows:\nIOException\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/FontProgramFactory.html
FontProgramFactory createType1Font	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ncreateType1Font\npublic static FontProgram createType1Font(String name,\n                                          byte[] afm,\n                                          byte[] pfb,\n                                          boolean cached)\n                                   throws IOException\nCreates a new font. This font can be one of the 14 built in types,\n a Type1 font referred to by an AFM or PFM file, a TrueType font (simple or collection) or a CJK font from the\n Adobe Asian Font Pack. TrueType fonts and CJK fonts can have an optional style modifier\n appended to the name. These modifiers are: Bold, Italic and BoldItalic. An\n example would be "STSong-Light,Bold". Note that this modifiers do not work if\n the font is embedded. Fonts in TrueType collections are addressed by index such as "msgothic.ttc,1".\n This would get the second font (indexes start at 0), in this case "MS PGothic".\n \n The fonts may or may not be cached depending on the flag cached.\n If the byte arrays are present the font will be\n read from them instead of the name. A name is still required to identify\n the font type.\n \n Besides the common encodings described by name, custom encodings\n can also be made. These encodings will only work for the single byte fonts\n Type1 and TrueType. The encoding string starts with a '#'\n followed by "simple" or "full". If "simple" there is a decimal for the first character position and then a list\n of hex values representing the Unicode codes that compose that encoding.\n The "simple" encoding is recommended for TrueType fonts\n as the "full" encoding risks not matching the character with the right glyph\n if not done with care.\n The "full" encoding is specially aimed at Type1 fonts where the glyphs have to be\n described by non standard names like the Tex math fonts. Each group of three elements\n compose a code position: the one byte code order in decimal or as 'x' (x cannot be the space), the name and the Unicode character\n used to access the glyph. The space must be assigned to character position 32 otherwise\n text justification will not work.\n \n Example for a "simple" encoding that includes the Unicode\n character space, A, B and ecyrillic:\n \n "# simple 32 0020 0041 0042 0454"\n \n\n Example for a "full" encoding for a Type1 Tex font:\n \n "# full 'A' nottriangeqlleft 0041 'B' dividemultiply 0042 32 space 0020"\n \n\nParameters:\nname - the name of the font or its location on file\ncached - true if the font comes from the cache or is added to\n               the cache if new, false if the font is always created new\nafm - the afm or pfm metrics file in a byte array\npfb - the pfb in a byte array\nReturns:\nreturns a new font. This font may come from the cache but only if cached\n is true, otherwise it will always be created new\nThrows:\nIOException\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/FontProgramFactory.html
FontProgramFactory createType1Font	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ncreateType1Font\npublic static FontProgram createType1Font(byte[] afm,\n                                          byte[] pfb)\n                                   throws IOException\n\nThrows:\nIOException\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/FontProgramFactory.html

FontProgramFactory createType1Font	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ncreateType1Font\npublic static FontProgram createType1Font(String metricsPath,\n                                          String binaryPath)\n                                   throws IOException\n\nThrows:\nIOException\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/FontProgramFactory.html
FontProgramFactory createFont	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ncreateFont\npublic static FontProgram createFont(String ttc,\n                                     int ttcIndex,\n                                     boolean cached)\n                              throws IOException\nCreates a new True Type font from ttc file,\n \n The fonts may or may not be cached depending on the flag cached.\n If the byte arrays are present the font will be\n read from them instead of the name. A name is still required to identify\n the font type.\n \n Besides the common encodings described by name, custom encodings\n can also be made. These encodings will only work for the single byte fonts\n Type1 and TrueType. The encoding string starts with a '#'\n followed by "simple" or "full". If "simple" there is a decimal for the first character position and then a list\n of hex values representing the Unicode codes that compose that encoding.\n The "simple" encoding is recommended for TrueType fonts\n as the "full" encoding risks not matching the character with the right glyph\n if not done with care.\n The "full" encoding is specially aimed at Type1 fonts where the glyphs have to be\n described by non standard names like the Tex math fonts. Each group of three elements\n compose a code position: the one byte code order in decimal or as 'x' (x cannot be the space), the name and the Unicode character\n used to access the glyph. The space must be assigned to character position 32 otherwise\n text justification will not work.\n \n Example for a "simple" encoding that includes the Unicode\n character space, A, B and ecyrillic:\n \n "# simple 32 0020 0041 0042 0454"\n \n\n Example for a "full" encoding for a Type1 Tex font:\n \n "# full 'A' nottriangeqlleft 0041 'B' dividemultiply 0042 32 space 0020"\n \n\nParameters:\nttc - location  of true type collection file (*.ttc)\nttcIndex - the encoding to be applied to this font\ncached - true if the font comes from the cache or is added to\n                 the cache if new, false if the font is always created new\nReturns:\nreturns a new font. This font may come from the cache but only if cached\n is true, otherwise it will always be created new\nThrows:\nIOException\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/FontProgramFactory.html

HashCode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This class is a convenience method to sequentially calculate hash code of the\n object based on the field values. The result depends on the order of elements\n appended. The exact formula is the same as for\n java.util.List.hashCode.\n\n If you need order independent hash code just summate, multiply or XOR all\n elements.\n\n \n Suppose we have class:\n\n \n class Thing {\n     long id;\n     String name;\n     float weight;\n }\n \n\n The hash code calculation can be expressed in 2 forms.\n\n \n For maximum performance:\n\n \n public int hashCode() {\n     int hashCode = HashCode.EMPTY_HASH_CODE;\n     hashCode = HashCode.combine(hashCode, id);\n     hashCode = HashCode.combine(hashCode, name);\n     hashCode = HashCode.combine(hashCode, weight);\n     return hashCode;\n }\n \n\n For convenience: \n public int hashCode() {\n     return new HashCode().append(id).append(name).append(weight).hashCode();\n }\n </p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/HashCode.html

HyphenationTree searchPatterns	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsearchPatterns\nprotected void searchPatterns(char[] word,\n                              int index,\n                              byte[] il)\nSearch for all possible partial matches of word starting\n at index an update interletter values. In other words, it\n does something like:\n\n for(i=0; i\nBut it is done in an efficient way since the patterns are\n stored in a ternary tree. In fact, this is the whole purpose\n of having the tree: doing this search without having to test\n every single pattern. The number of patterns for languages\n such as English range from 4000 to 10000. Thus, doing thousands\n of string comparisons for each word to hyphenate would be\n really slow without the tree. The tradeoff is memory, but\n using a ternary tree instead of a trie, almost halves the\n the memory used by Lout or TeX. It's also faster than using\n a hash table\n\nParameters:\nword - null terminated word to match\nindex - start index from word\nil - interletter values array to update\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/HyphenationTree.html
HyphenationTree hyphenate	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nhyphenate\npublic Hyphenation hyphenate(String word,\n                             int remainCharCount,\n                             int pushCharCount)\nHyphenate word and return a Hyphenation object.\n\nParameters:\nword - the word to be hyphenated\nremainCharCount - Minimum number of characters allowed\n before the hyphenation point.\npushCharCount - Minimum number of characters allowed after\n the hyphenation point.\nReturns:\na Hyphenation object representing\n the hyphenated word or null if word is not hyphenated.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/HyphenationTree.html

HyphenationTree addClass	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\naddClass\npublic void addClass(String chargroup)\nAdd a character class to the tree. It is used by\n PatternParser as callback to\n add character classes. Character classes define the\n valid word characters for hyphenation. If a word contains\n a character not defined in any of the classes, it is not hyphenated.\n It also defines a way to normalize the characters in order\n to compare them with the stored patterns. Usually pattern\n files use only lower case characters, in this case a class\n for letter 'a', for example, should be defined as "aA", the first\n character being the normalization char.\n\nSpecified by:\naddClass in interface IPatternConsumer\nParameters:\nchargroup - a character class (group)\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/HyphenationTree.html

ILargeElement	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A ILargeElement is a layout element which may get added to\n indefinitely, making the object prohibitively large.\n In order to avoid consuming and holding on to undesirable amounts of\n resources, the contents of a ILargeElement can be flushed regularly\n by client code, e.g. at page boundaries or after a certain amount of additions.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/ILargeElement.html

IntHashtable contains	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ncontains\npublic boolean contains(int value)\nTests if some key maps into the specified value in this hashtable.\n This operation is more expensive than the containsKey\n method.\nNote that this method is identical in functionality to containsValue,\n (which is part of the Map interface in the collections framework).\n\nParameters:\nvalue - a value to search for.\nReturns:\ntrue if and only if some key maps to the\n             value argument in this hashtable as\n             determined by the equals method;\n             false otherwise.\nThrows:\nNullPointerException - if the value is null.\nSee Also:\ncontainsKey(int), \ncontainsValue(int), \nMap\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/IntHashtable.html

The key cannot be\n null. \nThe value can be retrieved by calling the get method\n with a key that is equal to the original key.\n\nParameters:\nkey - the hashtable key.\nvalue - the value.\nReturns:\nthe previous value of the specified key in this hashtable,\n         or null if it did not have one.\nThrows:\nNullPointerException - if the key is null.\nSee Also:\nget(int)\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/IntHashtable.html

IRandomAccessSource get	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nget\nint get(long position,\n        byte[] bytes,\n        int off,\n        int len)\n throws IOException\nGets an array at the specified position.  If the number of bytes requested cannot be read, the bytes that can be\n read will be placed in bytes and the number actually read will be returned.\n\nParameters:\nposition - the position in the RandomAccessSource to read from\nbytes - output buffer\noff - offset into the output buffer where results will be placed\nlen - the number of bytes to read\nReturns:\nthe number of bytes actually read, or -1 if the file is at EOF\nThrows:\nIOException\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/IRandomAccessSource.html

IRandomAccessSource	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Represents an abstract source that bytes can be read from.  This class forms the foundation for all byte input in iText.\n Implementations do not keep track of a current 'position', but rather provide absolute get methods.  Tracking position\n should be handled in classes that use RandomAccessSource internally (via composition).</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/IRandomAccessSource.html

IRenderer layout	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nlayout\nLayoutResult layout(LayoutContext layoutContext)\nThis method simulates positioning of the renderer, including all of its children, and returns\n the LayoutResult, representing the layout result, including occupied area, status, i.e.\n if there was enough place to fit the renderer subtree, etc.\n LayoutResult can be extended to return custom layout results for custom elements, e.g.\n TextRenderer uses TextLayoutResult as its result.\n\n This method can be called standalone to learn how much area the renderer subtree needs, or can be called\n before draw(DrawContext), to prepare the renderer to be flushed to the output stream.\n\nParameters:\nlayoutContext - the description of layout area and any other additional information\nReturns:\nresult of the layout process\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/IRenderer.html

IRenderer	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A renderer object is responsible for drawing a corresponding layout object on\n a document or canvas. ISO8601Converter parse	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nparse\npublic static XMPDateTime parse(String iso8601String)\n                         throws XMPException\nConverts an ISO 8601 string to an XMPDateTime.\n \n Parse a date according to ISO 8601 and\n http://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime:\n \nYYYY\n YYYY-MM\n YYYY-MM-DD\n YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmTZD\n YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssTZD\n YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sTZD\n \n \n Data fields:\n \nYYYY = four-digit year\n MM = two-digit month (01=January, etc.)\n DD = two-digit day of month (01 through 31)\n hh = two digits of hour (00 through 23)\n mm = two digits of minute (00 through 59)\n ss = two digits of second (00 through 59)\n s = one or more digits representing a decimal fraction of a second\n TZD = time zone designator (Z or +hh:mm or -hh:mm)\n \n \n Note that ISO 8601 does not seem to allow years less than 1000 or greater\n than 9999. We allow any year, even negative ones. The year is formatted\n as "%.4d".\n \nNote: Tolerate missing TZD, assume is UTC. Photoshop 8 writes\n dates like this for exif:GPSTimeStamp.\nNote: DOES NOT APPLY ANYMORE.\n Tolerate missing date portion, in case someone foolishly\n writes a time-only value that way.\n\nParameters:\niso8601String - a date string that is ISO 8601 conform.\nReturns:\nReturns a Calendar.\nThrows:\nXMPException - Is thrown when the string is non-conform.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/ISO8601Converter.html
ISO8601Converter parse	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nparse\npublic static XMPDateTime parse(String iso8601String,\n                                XMPDateTime binValue)\n                         throws XMPException\n\nParameters:\niso8601String - a date string that is ISO 8601 conform.\nbinValue - an existing XMPDateTime to set with the parsed date\nReturns:\nReturns an XMPDateTime-object containing the ISO8601-date.\nThrows:\nXMPException - Is thrown when the string is non-conform.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/ISO8601Converter.html
ISO8601Converter	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Converts between ISO 8601 Strings and Calendar with millisecond resolution.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/ISO8601Converter.html

Leading	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A specialized class that specifies the leading, "the vertical distance between\n the baselines of adjacent lines of text" (ISO-32000-1, section 9.3.5).\n Allows to use either an absolute (constant) leading value, or one\n determined by font size. LineSegment getBoundingRectange	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ngetBoundingRectange\n@Deprecated\npublic Rectangle getBoundingRectange()\nDeprecated. Use getBoundingRectangle(). Will be removed in 7.1\nComputes the bounding rectangle for this line segment.  The rectangle has a rotation 0 degrees\n with respect to the coordinate system that the line system is in.  For example, if a line segment\n is 5 unit long and sits at a 37 degree angle from horizontal, the bounding rectangle will have\n origin of the lower left hand end point of the segment, with width = 4 and height = 3.\n\nReturns:\nthe bounding rectangle\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/LineSegment.html

The rectangle has a rotation 0 degrees\n with respect to the coordinate system that the line system is in.  For example, if a line segment\n is 5 unit long and sits at a 37 degree angle from horizontal, the bounding rectangle will have\n origin of the lower left hand end point of the segment, with width = 4 and height = 3.\n\nReturns:\nthe bounding rectangle\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/LineSegment.html

LZWStringTable expandCode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nexpandCode\npublic int expandCode(byte[] buf,\n                      int offset,\n                      short code,\n                      int skipHead)\nIf expanded data doesn't fit into array only what will fit is written\n to buf and the return value indicates how much of the expanded code has\n been written to the buf. The next call to expandCode() should be with\n the same code and have the skip parameter set the negated value of the\n previous return. Successive negative return values should be negated and\n added together for next skip parameter value with same code.\n\nParameters:\nbuf - buffer to place expanded data into\noffset - offset to place expanded data\ncode - the code to expand to the byte array it represents.\n                 PRECONDITION This code must already be in the LZSS\nskipHead - is the number of bytes at the start of the expanded code to\n                 be skipped before data is written to buf. It is possible that skipHead is\n                 equal to codeLen.\nReturns:\nthe length of data expanded into buf. If the expanded code is longer\n than space left in buf then the value returned is a negative number which when\n negated is equal to the number of bytes that were used of the code being expanded.\n This negative value also indicates the buffer is full.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/LZWStringTable.html

PdfAChecker checkedObjects	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ncheckedObjects\nprotected Set<PdfObject> checkedObjects\nContains some objects that are already checked.\n NOTE: Not all objects that were checked are stored in that set. This set is used for avoiding double checks for\n actions, xObjects and page objects; and for letting those objects to be manually flushed.\n\n Use this mechanism carefully: objects that are able to be changed (or at least if object's properties\n that shall be checked are able to be changed) shouldn't be marked as checked if they are not to be\n flushed immediately.\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAChecker.html

PdfAChecker	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An abstract class that will run through all necessary checks defined in the\n different PDF/A standards and levels. A number of common checks are executed\n in this class, while standard-dependent specifications are implemented in the\n available subclasses. The standard that is followed is the series of ISO\n 19005 specifications, currently generations 1 through 3. The ZUGFeRD standard\n is derived from ISO 19005-3.\n \n While it is possible to subclass this method and implement its abstract\n methods in client code, this is not encouraged and will have little effect.\n It is not possible to plug custom implementations into iText, because iText\n should always refuse to create non-compliant PDF/A, which would be possible\n with client code implementations. Any future generations of the PDF/A\n standard and its derivates will get their own implementation in the\n iText 7 - pdfa project.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAChecker.html

PdfAcroForm SIGNATURE_EXIST	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nSIGNATURE_EXIST\npublic static final int SIGNATURE_EXIST\nTo be used with setSignatureFlags(int).\n \n\n If set, the document contains at least one signature field. This flag\n allows a conforming reader to enable user interface items (such as menu\n items or pushbuttons) related to signature processing without having to\n scan the entire document for the presence of signature fields.\n (ISO 32000-1, section 12.7.2 "Interactive Form Dictionary")\n \n\nSee Also:\nConstant Field Values\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAcroForm.html
PdfAcroForm APPEND_ONLY	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nAPPEND_ONLY\npublic static final int APPEND_ONLY\nTo be used with setSignatureFlags(int).\n \n\n If set, the document contains signatures that may be invalidated if the\n file is saved (written) in a way that alters its previous contents, as\n opposed to an incremental update. Merely updating the file by appending\n new information to the end of the previous version is safe. Conforming\n readers may use this flag to inform a user requesting a full save that\n signatures will be invalidated and require explicit confirmation before\n continuing with the operation.\n (ISO 32000-1, section 12.7.2 "Interactive Form Dictionary")\n \n\nSee Also:\nConstant Field Values\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAcroForm.html

Default is\n true.\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAcroForm.html

Use SIGNATURE_EXIST and/or APPEND_ONLY.\n                 Use bitwise OR operator to combine these values. PdfAcroForm setGenerateAppearance	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsetGenerateAppearance\npublic void setGenerateAppearance(boolean generateAppearance)\nSets the attribute generateAppearance, which tells flattenFields()\n to generate an appearance Stream for all form fields\n that don't have one.\n \n Not generating appearances will speed up form flattening but the results\n can be unexpected in Acrobat. Don't use it unless your environment is\n well controlled. The default is true.\n \n If generateAppearance is set to true, then\n NeedAppearances is set to false. This does not\n apply vice versa.\n\nParameters:\ngenerateAppearance - a boolean\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAcroForm.html

PdfAcroForm isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nisWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect\nprotected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()\nDescription copied from class: PdfObjectWrapper\nDefines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the\n resultant document.\n \n If this method returns true it doesn't necessarily mean that object\n must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that\n when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into\n indirect object if it's not indirect yet.\n \n Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return\n always true or false.\n\nSpecified by:\nisWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect in class PdfObjectWrapper<PdfDictionary>\nReturns:\ntrue if in the resultant document the object behind the wrapper\n          must be indirect, otherwise false.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAcroForm.html

PdfAction createSound	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ncreateSound\npublic static PdfAction createSound(PdfStream sound,\n                                    float volume,\n                                    boolean synchronous,\n                                    boolean repeat,\n                                    boolean mix)\nCreates a Sound action (section 12.6.4.8 of ISO 32000-1).\n\nParameters:\nsound - a sound object defining the sound that shall be played (see section 13.3 of ISO 32000-1)\nvolume - the volume at which to play the sound, in the range -1.0 to 1.0. Default value: 1.0\nsynchronous - a flag specifying whether to play the sound synchronously or asynchronously.\n                    If this flag is true, the conforming reader retains control, allowing no further user\n                    interaction other than canceling the sound, until the sound has been completely played.\n                    Default value: false\nrepeat - a flag specifying whether to repeat the sound indefinitely\n                    If this entry is present, the Synchronous entry shall be ignored. Default value: false\nmix - a flag specifying whether to mix this sound with any other sound already playing\nReturns:\ncreated action\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAction.html

PdfAction flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nflush\npublic void flush()\nTo manually flush a PdfObject behind this wrapper, you have to ensure\n that this object is added to the document, i.e. it has an indirect reference.\n Basically this means that before flushing you need to explicitly call PdfObjectWrapper.makeIndirect(PdfDocument).\n For example: wrapperInstance.makeIndirect(document).flush();\n Note that not every wrapper require this, only those that have such warning in documentation.\n\nOverrides:\nflush in class PdfObjectWrapper<PdfDictionary>\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAction.html

PdfADocument	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This class extends PdfDocument and is in charge of creating files\n that comply with the PDF/A standard.\n \n Client code is still responsible for making sure the file is actually PDF/A\n compliant: multiple steps must be undertaken (depending on the\n PdfAConformanceLevel) to ensure that the PDF/A standard is followed.\n \n This class will throw exceptions, mostly PdfAConformanceException, \n and thus refuse to output a PDF/A file if at any point the document does not\n adhere to the PDF/A guidelines specified by the PdfAConformanceLevel.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfADocument.html

PdfAnnotation getFlags	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ngetFlags\npublic int getFlags()\nA set of flags specifying various characteristics of the annotation (see ISO-320001 12.5.3, âAnnotation Flagsâ).\n For specific annotation flag constants see setFlag(int).\n Default value: 0.\n\nReturns:\nan integer interpreted as one-bit flags specifying various characteristics of the annotation.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAnnotation.html
PdfAnnotation setFlags	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsetFlags\npublic PdfAnnotation setFlags(int flags)\nSets a set of flags specifying various characteristics of the annotation (see ISO-320001 12.5.3, âAnnotation Flagsâ).\n On the contrary from setFlag(int), this method sets a complete set of enabled and disabled flags at once.\n If not set specifically the default value is 0.\n\nParameters:\nflags - an integer interpreted as set of one-bit flags specifying various characteristics of the annotation.\nReturns:\nthis PdfAnnotation instance.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAnnotation.html
PdfAnnotation setFlag	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsetFlag\npublic PdfAnnotation setFlag(int flag)\nSets a flag that specifies a characteristic of the annotation to enabled state (see ISO-320001 12.5.3, âAnnotation Flagsâ).\n On the contrary from setFlags(int), this method sets only specified flags to enabled state,\n but doesn't disable other flags.\n Possible flags:\n \nINVISIBLE - If set, do not display the annotation if it does not belong to one of the\n     standard annotation types and no annotation handler is available. If clear, display such unknown annotation\n     using an appearance stream specified by its appearance dictionary, if any.\n     \nHIDDEN - If set, do not display or print the annotation or allow it to interact with\n     the user, regardless of its annotation type or whether an annotation handler is available.\n     \nPRINT - If set, print the annotation when the page is printed. If clear, never print\n     the annotation, regardless of whether it is displayed on the screen.\n     \nNO_ZOOM - If set, do not scale the annotationâs appearance to match the magnification of\n     the page. The location of the annotation on the page (defined by the upper-left corner of its annotation\n     rectangle) shall remain fixed, regardless of the page magnification.}\n     \nNO_ROTATE - If set, do not rotate the annotationâs appearance to match the rotation\n     of the page. The upper-left corner of the annotation rectangle shall remain in a fixed location on the page,\n     regardless of the page rotation.\n     \nNO_VIEW - If set, do not display the annotation on the screen or allow it to interact\n     with the user. The annotation may be printed (depending on the setting of the Print flag) but should be considered\n     hidden for purposes of on-screen display and user interaction.\n     \nREAD_ONLY -  If set, do not allow the annotation to interact with the user. The annotation\n     may be displayed or printed (depending on the settings of the NoView and Print flags) but should not respond to mouse\n     clicks or change its appearance in response to mouse motions.\n     \nLOCKED -  If set, do not allow the annotation to be deleted or its properties\n     (including position and size) to be modified by the user. However, this flag does not restrict changes to\n     the annotationâs contents, such as the value of a form field.\n     \nTOGGLE_NO_VIEW - If set, invert the interpretation of the NoView flag for certain events.\n     \nLOCKED_CONTENTS - If set, do not allow the contents of the annotation to be modified\n     by the user. This flag does not restrict deletion of the annotation or changes to other annotation properties,\n     such as position and size.\n     \n\n\nParameters:\nflag - - an integer interpreted as set of one-bit flags which will be enabled for this annotation.\nReturns:\nthis PdfAnnotation instance.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAnnotation.html
PdfAnnotation resetFlag	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nresetFlag\npublic PdfAnnotation resetFlag(int flag)\nResets a flag that specifies a characteristic of the annotation to disabled state (see ISO-320001 12.5.3, âAnnotation Flagsâ).\n\nParameters:\nflag - an integer interpreted as set of one-bit flags which will be reset to disabled state.\nReturns:\nthis PdfAnnotation instance.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAnnotation.html
PdfAnnotation hasFlag	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nhasFlag\npublic boolean hasFlag(int flag)\nChecks if the certain flag that specifies a characteristic of the annotation\n is in enabled state (see ISO-320001 12.5.3, âAnnotation Flagsâ).\n This method allows only one flag to be checked at once, use constants listed in setFlag(int).\n\nParameters:\nflag - an integer interpreted as set of one-bit flags. Only one bit must be set in this integer, otherwise\n             exception is thrown.\nReturns:\ntrue if the given flag is in enabled state.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAnnotation.html
PdfAnnotation getAppearanceDictionary	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ngetAppearanceDictionary\npublic PdfDictionary getAppearanceDictionary()\nAn appearance dictionary specifying how the annotation shall be presented visually on the page during its\n interactions with the user (see ISO-320001 12.5.5, âAppearance Streamsâ). An appearance dictionary is a dictionary\n containing one or several appearance streams or subdictionaries.\n\nReturns:\nan appearance PdfDictionary or null if it is not specified.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAnnotation.html
PdfAnnotation getAppearanceObject	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ngetAppearanceObject\npublic PdfDictionary getAppearanceObject(PdfName appearanceType)\nSpecific appearance object corresponding to the specific appearance type. This object might be either an appearance\n stream or an appearance subdictionary. In the latter case, the subdictionary defines multiple appearance streams\n corresponding to different appearance states of the annotation. See ISO-320001 12.5.5, âAppearance Streamsâ.\n\nParameters:\nappearanceType - a PdfName specifying appearance type. Possible types are Normal,\n                       Rollover and Down.\nReturns:\nnull if their is no such appearance type or an appearance object which might be either\n an appearance stream or an appearance subdictionary.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAnnotation.html
PdfAnnotation getNormalAppearanceObject	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ngetNormalAppearanceObject\npublic PdfDictionary getNormalAppearanceObject()\nThe normal appearance is used when the annotation is not interacting with the user.\n This appearance is also used for printing the annotation.\n See also getAppearanceObject(PdfName).\n\nReturns:\nan appearance object which might be either an appearance stream or an appearance subdictionary.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAnnotation.html

PdfAnnotation getBorder	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ngetBorder\npublic PdfArray getBorder()\n\n An array specifying the characteristics of the annotationâs border.\n The array consists of three numbers defining the horizontal corner radius,\n vertical corner radius, and border width, all in default user space units.\n If the corner radii are 0, the border has square (not rounded) corners; if\n the border width is 0, no border is drawn.\n \n The array may have a fourth element, an optional dash array (see ISO-320001 8.4.3.6, âLine Dash Patternâ).\n\nReturns:\nan PdfArray specifying the characteristics of the annotationâs border.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAnnotation.html

PdfAnnotation getColorObject	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ngetColorObject\npublic PdfArray getColorObject()\nAn array of numbers in the range 0.0 to 1.0, representing a colour used for the following purposes:\n \nThe background of the annotationâs icon when closed\nThe title bar of the annotationâs pop-up window\nThe border of a link annotation\n\n The number of array elements determines the colour space in which the colour shall be defined:\n \n0 - No colour; transparent\n1 - DeviceGray\n3 - DeviceRGB\n4 - DeviceCMYK\n\n\nReturns:\nAn array of numbers in the range 0.0 to 1.0, representing an annotation colour.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAnnotation.html
