PdfAnnotation setOpen	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsetOpen\npublic PdfAnnotation setOpen(boolean open)\nSets a flag specifying whether the annotation shall initially be displayed open.\n This flag has affect to not all kinds of annotations.\n\nParameters:\nopen - true if annotation shall initially be open, false - if closed.\nReturns:\nthis PdfAnnotation instance.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAnnotation.html
PdfAnnotation getQuadPoints	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ngetQuadPoints\npublic PdfArray getQuadPoints()\nAn array of 8 Ã n numbers specifying the coordinates of n quadrilaterals in default user space.\n Quadrilaterals are used to define:\n \nregions inside annotation rectangle in which the link annotation should be activated;\na word or group of contiguous words in the text underlying the text markup annotation;\nthe content region that is intended to be removed for a redaction annotation;\n\n\n IMPORTANT NOTE: According to Table 179 in ISO 32000-1, the QuadPoints array lists the vertices in counterclockwise\n order and the text orientation is defined by the first and second vertex. This basically means QuadPoints is\n specified as lower-left, lower-right, top-right, top-left. HOWEVER, Adobe's interpretation\n (tested at least with Acrobat 10, Acrobat 11, Reader 11) is top-left, top-right, lower-left, lower-right (Z-shaped order).\n This means that if the QuadPoints array is specified according to the standard, the rendering is not as expected.\n Other viewers seem to follow Adobe's interpretation. Hence we recommend to use and expect QuadPoints array in Z-order,\n just as Acrobat and probably most other viewers expect.\n\nReturns:\nan PdfArray of 8 Ã n numbers specifying the coordinates of n quadrilaterals.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAnnotation.html
PdfAnnotation setQuadPoints	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsetQuadPoints\npublic PdfAnnotation setQuadPoints(PdfArray quadPoints)\nSets n quadrilaterals in default user space by passing an PdfArray of 8 Ã n numbers. For more info of what\n quadrilaterals define see getQuadPoints().\n\n \n IMPORTANT NOTE: According to Table 179 in ISO 32000-1, the QuadPoints array lists the vertices in counterclockwise\n order and the text orientation is defined by the first and second vertex. This basically means QuadPoints is\n specified as lower-left, lower-right, top-right, top-left. HOWEVER, Adobe's interpretation\n (tested at least with Acrobat 10, Acrobat 11, Reader 11) is top-left, top-right, lower-left, lower-right (Z-shaped order).\n This means that if the QuadPoints array is specified according to the standard, the rendering is not as expected.\n Other viewers seem to follow Adobe's interpretation. Hence we recommend to use and expect QuadPoints array in Z-order,\n just as Acrobat and probably most other viewers expect.\n\nParameters:\nquadPoints - an PdfArray of 8 Ã n numbers specifying the coordinates of n quadrilaterals.\nReturns:\nthis PdfAnnotation instance.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAnnotation.html

PdfAnnotation setBorderStyle	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsetBorderStyle\npublic PdfAnnotation setBorderStyle(PdfName style)\nSetter for the annotation's preset border style. Possible values are\n \nSTYLE_SOLID - A solid rectangle surrounding the annotation.\nSTYLE_DASHED - A dashed rectangle surrounding the annotation.\nSTYLE_BEVELED - A simulated embossed rectangle that appears to be raised above the surface of the page.\nSTYLE_INSET - A simulated engraved rectangle that appears to be recessed below the surface of the page.\nSTYLE_UNDERLINE - A single line along the bottom of the annotation rectangle.\n\n See also ISO-320001, Table 166.\n\nParameters:\nstyle - The new value for the annotation's border style.\nReturns:\nThe annotation which this method was called on.\nSee Also:\ngetBorderStyle()\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAnnotation.html

PdfAnnotation getBorderStyle	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ngetBorderStyle\npublic PdfDictionary getBorderStyle()\nThe dictionaries for some annotation types (such as free text and polygon annotations) can include the BS entry.\n That entry specifies a border style dictionary that has more settings than the array specified for the Border\n entry (see getBorder()). If an annotation dictionary includes the BS entry, then the Border\n entry is ignored. If annotation includes AP (see getAppearanceDictionary()) it takes\n precedence over the BS entry. For more info on BS entry see ISO-320001, Table 166.\n\nReturns:\nPdfDictionary which is a border style dictionary or null if it is not specified.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfAnnotation.html

PdfCanvas	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>PdfCanvas class represents an algorithm for writing data into content stream.\n To write into page content, create PdfCanvas from a page instance.\n To write into form XObject, create PdfCanvas from a form XObject instance.\n Make sure to call PdfCanvas.release() after you finished writing to the canvas.\n It will save some memory.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfCanvas.html

PdfCanvasConstants.LineCapStyle	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The line cap style specifies the shape to be used at the ends of open\n subpaths (and dashes, if any) when they are stroked.\n \n All documentation for this class is taken from ISO 32000-1, section\n 8.4.3.3 "Line Cap Style".</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfCanvasConstants.LineCapStyle.html
PdfCanvasConstants.LineJoinStyle MITER	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nMITER\npublic static final int MITER\nThe outer edges of the strokes for the two segments are extended\n until they meet at an angle, as in a picture frame. If the segments\n meet at too sharp an angle, a bevel join is used instead.\n\nSee Also:\nConstant Field Values\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfCanvasConstants.LineJoinStyle.html
PdfCanvasConstants.LineJoinStyle ROUND	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nROUND\npublic static final int ROUND\nAn arc of a circle with a diameter equal to the line width is drawn\n around the point where the two segments meet, connecting the outer\n edges of the strokes for the two segments. This pieslice-shaped\n figure is filled in, producing a rounded corner.\n\nSee Also:\nConstant Field Values\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfCanvasConstants.LineJoinStyle.html
PdfCanvasConstants.LineJoinStyle	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The line join style specifies the shape to be used at the corners of\n paths that are stroked. Join styles are significant only at points where\n consecutive segments of a path connect at an angle; segments that meet or\n intersect fortuitously receive no special treatment.\n \n All documentation for this class is taken from ISO 32000-1, section\n 8.4.3.4 "Line Join Style".</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfCanvasConstants.LineJoinStyle.html

PdfCanvasConstants.TextRenderingMode	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The text rendering mode determines whether showing text causes glyph\n outlines to be stroked, filled, used as a clipping boundary, or some\n combination of the three. Stroking, filling, and clipping have the same\n effects for a text object as they do for a path object, although they are\n specified in an entirely different way.\n \n If the text rendering mode calls for filling, the current nonstroking\n color in the graphics state is used; if it calls for stroking, the\n current stroking color is used.\n \n All documentation for this class is taken from ISO 32000-1, section 9.3.6\n "Text Rendering Mode".</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfCanvasConstants.TextRenderingMode.html

PdfCanvasParser parse	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nparse\npublic List<PdfObject> parse(List<PdfObject> ls)\n                      throws IOException\nParses a single command from the content. Each command is output as an array of arguments\n having the command itself as the last element. The returned array will be empty if the\n end of content was reached.\n \n A specific behaviour occurs when inline image is encountered (BI command):\n in that case, parser would continue parsing until it meets EI - end of the inline image;\n as a result in this case it will return an array with inline image dictionary and image bytes\n encapsulated in PdfStream object as first element and EI command as second element.\n\nParameters:\nls - an ArrayList to use. It will be cleared before using. If it's\n null will create a new ArrayList\nReturns:\nthe same ArrayList given as argument or a new one\nThrows:\nIOException - on error\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfCanvasParser.html

PdfDate	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>PdfDate is the PDF date object.\n \n PDF defines a standard date format. The PDF date format closely follows the format\n defined by the international standard ASN.1 (Abstract Syntax Notation One, defined\n in CCITT X.208 or ISO/IEC 8824). A date is a PdfString of the form:\n \n (D:YYYYMMDDHHmmSSOHH'mm')\n \n This object is described in the 'Portable Document Format Reference Manual version 1.3'\n section 7.2 (page 183-184)</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfDate.html

PdfDeveloperExtension	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Beginning with BaseVersion 1.7, the extensions dictionary lets developers\n designate that a given document contains extensions to PDF. The presence\n of the extension dictionary in a document indicates that it may contain\n developer-specific PDF properties that extend a particular base version\n of the PDF specification.\n The extensions dictionary enables developers to identify their own extensions\n relative to a base version of PDF. Additionally, the convention identifies\n extension levels relative to that base version. The intent of this dictionary\n is to enable developers of PDF-producing applications to identify company-specific\n specifications (such as this one) that PDF-consuming applications use to\n interpret the extensions.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfDeveloperExtension.html

In opposite to values() method,\n this method will resolve all indirect references in the dictionary and return actual objects in collection.\n\nReturns:\na Collection holding all the values\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfDictionary.html

PdfDictionary copyTo	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ncopyTo\npublic PdfDictionary copyTo(PdfDocument document,\n                            boolean allowDuplicating)\nCopies object to a specified document.\n Works only for objects that are read from existing document, otherwise an exception is thrown.\n\nOverrides:\ncopyTo in class PdfObject\nParameters:\ndocument - document to copy object to.\nallowDuplicating - indicates if to allow copy objects which already have been copied.\n                         If object is associated with any indirect reference and allowDuplicating is false then already existing reference will be returned instead of copying object.\n                         If allowDuplicating is true then object will be copied and new indirect reference will be assigned.\nReturns:\ncopied object.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfDictionary.html

PdfDictionary	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A representation of a Dictionary as described by the PDF Specification. A Dictionary is a mapping between keys\n and values. Keys are PdfNames and the values are\n PdfObjects. Each key can only be associated with one value and\n adding a new value to an existing key will override the previous value. A value of null should be ignored when\n the PdfDocument is closed.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfDictionary.html

PdfExtGState put	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nput\npublic PdfExtGState put(PdfName key,\n                        PdfObject value)\nPuts the value into Graphics state parameter dictionary and associates it with the specified key.\n If the key is already present, it will override the old value with the specified one.\n\nParameters:\nkey - key to insert or to override\nvalue - the value to associate with the specified key\nReturns:\nobject itself.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfExtGState.html
PdfExtGState flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nflush\npublic void flush()\nTo manually flush a PdfObject behind this wrapper, you have to ensure\n that this object is added to the document, i.e. it has an indirect reference.\n Basically this means that before flushing you need to explicitly call PdfObjectWrapper.makeIndirect(PdfDocument).\n For example: wrapperInstance.makeIndirect(document).flush();\n Note that not every wrapper require this, only those that have such warning in documentation.\n\nOverrides:\nflush in class PdfObjectWrapper<PdfDictionary>\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfExtGState.html

PdfFormField makeFieldFlag	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nmakeFieldFlag\npublic static int makeFieldFlag(int bitPosition)\nMakes a field flag by bit position. Bit positions are numbered 1 to 32.\n But position 0 corresponds to flag 1, position 3 corresponds to flag 4 etc.\n\nParameters:\nbitPosition - bit position of a flag in range 1 to 32 from the pdf specification.\nReturns:\ncorresponding field flag.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfFormField.html

The type of the object\n depends on the FT entry in the pdfObject parameter.\n\nParameters:\npdfObject - assumed to be either a PdfDictionary, or a\n                  PdfIndirectReference to a PdfDictionary\ndocument - the PdfDocument to create the field in\nReturns:\na new PdfFormField, or null if\n pdfObject does not contain a FT entry\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfFormField.html

PdfFormField isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nisWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect\nprotected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()\nDescription copied from class: PdfObjectWrapper\nDefines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the\n resultant document.\n \n If this method returns true it doesn't necessarily mean that object\n must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that\n when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into\n indirect object if it's not indirect yet.\n \n Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return\n always true or false.\n\nSpecified by:\nisWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect in class PdfObjectWrapper<PdfDictionary>\nReturns:\ntrue if in the resultant document the object behind the wrapper\n          must be indirect, otherwise false.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfFormField.html

PdfImageXObject identifyImageType	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nidentifyImageType\npublic ImageType identifyImageType()\nIdentifies the type of the image that is stored in the bytes of this PdfImageXObject.\n Note that this has nothing to do with the original type of the image. For instance, the return value\n of this method will never be ImageType.PNG as we loose this information when converting a\n PNG image into something that can be put into a PDF file.\n The possible values are: ImageType.JPEG, ImageType.JPEG2000, ImageType.JBIG2,\n ImageType.TIFF, ImageType.PNG\n\nReturns:\nthe identified type of image\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfImageXObject.html

PdfLayer isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nisWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect\nprotected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()\nDescription copied from class: PdfObjectWrapper\nDefines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the\n resultant document.\n \n If this method returns true it doesn't necessarily mean that object\n must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that\n when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into\n indirect object if it's not indirect yet.\n \n Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return\n always true or false.\n\nSpecified by:\nisWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect in class PdfObjectWrapper<PdfDictionary>\nReturns:\ntrue if in the resultant document the object behind the wrapper\n          must be indirect, otherwise false.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfLayer.html

PdfLayerMembership setVisibilityPolicy	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsetVisibilityPolicy\npublic void setVisibilityPolicy(PdfName visibilityPolicy)\nSets the visibility policy for content belonging to this\n membership dictionary. Possible values are AllOn, AnyOn, AnyOff and AllOff.\n AllOn - Visible only if all of the entries are ON.\n AnyOn - Visible if any of the entries are ON.\n AnyOff - Visible if any of the entries are OFF.\n AllOff - Visible only if all of the entries are OFF.\n The default value is AnyOn.\n\nParameters:\nvisibilityPolicy - the visibility policy\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfLayerMembership.html

PdfLayerMembership	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Content typically belongs to a single optional content group,\n and is visible when the group is ON and invisible when it is OFF. To express more\n complex visibility policies, content should not declare itself to belong to an optional\n content group directly, but rather to an optional content membership dictionary\n represented by this class.\n\n \n To be able to be wrapped with this PdfObjectWrapper the PdfObject\n must be indirect.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfLayerMembership.html

See PdfAnnotation.setRectangle(PdfArray).\nline - an array of four numbers, [x1 y1 x2 y2], specifying the starting and ending coordinates\n             of the line in default user space. PdfLineAnnotation getSubtype	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ngetSubtype\npublic PdfName getSubtype()\nGets a PdfName which value is a subtype of this annotation.\n See ISO-320001 12.5.6, âAnnotation Typesâ for the reference to the possible types.\n\nSpecified by:\ngetSubtype in class PdfAnnotation\nReturns:\nsubtype of this annotation.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfLineAnnotation.html
PdfLineAnnotation getLine	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ngetLine\npublic PdfArray getLine()\nAn array of four numbers, [x1 y1 x2 y2], specifying the starting and ending coordinates of the line\n in default user space. If the PdfName.LL (see getLeaderLine()) entry is present, this value represents\n the endpoints of the leader lines rather than the endpoints of the line itself.\n\nReturns:\nAn array of four numbers specifying the starting and ending coordinates of the line in default user space.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfLineAnnotation.html
PdfLineAnnotation getLineEndingStyles	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ngetLineEndingStyles\npublic PdfArray getLineEndingStyles()\nAn array of two names specifying the line ending styles that is used in drawing the line.\n The first and second elements of the array shall specify the line ending styles for the endpoints defined,\n respectively, by the first and second pairs of coordinates, (x1, y1) and (x2, y2), in the PdfName.L array\n (see getLine(). For possible values see setLineEndingStyles(PdfArray).\n\nReturns:\nAn array of two names specifying the line ending styles that is used in drawing the line; or null if line\n endings style is not explicitly defined, default value is [/None /None].\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfLineAnnotation.html
PdfLineAnnotation setLineEndingStyles	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsetLineEndingStyles\npublic PdfLineAnnotation setLineEndingStyles(PdfArray lineEndingStyles)\nSets the line ending styles that are used in drawing the line.\n The first and second elements of the array shall specify the line ending styles for the endpoints defined,\n respectively, by the first and second pairs of coordinates, (x1, y1) and (x2, y2), in the PdfName.L array\n (see getLine(). Possible values for styles are:\n \nPdfName.Square - A square filled with the annotation's interior color, if any; \nPdfName.Circle - A circle filled with the annotation's interior color, if any; \nPdfName.Diamond - A diamond shape filled with the annotation's interior color, if any; \nPdfName.OpenArrow - Two short lines meeting in an acute angle to form an open arrowhead; \nPdfName.ClosedArrow - Two short lines meeting in an acute angle as in the PdfName.OpenArrow style and\n     connected by a third line to form a triangular closed arrowhead filled with the annotation's interior color, if any; \nPdfName.None - No line ending; \nPdfName.Butt - A short line at the endpoint perpendicular to the line itself; \nPdfName.ROpenArrow - Two short lines in the reverse direction from PdfName.OpenArrow; \nPdfName.RClosedArrow - A triangular closed arrowhead in the reverse direction from PdfName.ClosedArrow; \nPdfName.Slash - A short line at the endpoint approximately 30 degrees clockwise from perpendicular to the line itself; \n\n see also ISO-320001, Table 176 "Line ending styles".\n\nParameters:\nlineEndingStyles - An array of two names specifying the line ending styles that is used in drawing the line.\nReturns:\nthis PdfLineAnnotation instance.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfLineAnnotation.html
PdfLineAnnotation getLeaderLine	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ngetLeaderLine\n@Deprecated\npublic float getLeaderLine()\nDeprecated. use getLeaderLineLength() instead.\nThe length of leader lines in default user space that extend from each endpoint of the line perpendicular\n to the line itself. A positive value means that the leader lines appear in the direction that is clockwise\n when traversing the line from its starting point to its ending point (as specified by PdfName.L (see getLine());\n a negative value indicates the opposite direction.\n\nReturns:\na float specifying the length of leader lines in default user space.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfLineAnnotation.html
PdfLineAnnotation setLeaderLine	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsetLeaderLine\n@Deprecated\npublic PdfLineAnnotation setLeaderLine(float leaderLine)\nDeprecated. use setLeaderLineLength(float) instead.\nSets the length of leader lines in default user space that extend from each endpoint of the line perpendicular\n to the line itself. A positive value means that the leader lines appear in the direction that is clockwise\n when traversing the line from its starting point to its ending point (as specified by PdfName.L (see getLine());\n a negative value indicates the opposite direction.\n\nParameters:\nleaderLine - a float specifying the length of leader lines in default user space.\nReturns:\nthis PdfLineAnnotation instance.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfLineAnnotation.html
PdfLineAnnotation getLeaderLineLength	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ngetLeaderLineLength\npublic float getLeaderLineLength()\nThe length of leader lines in default user space that extend from each endpoint of the line perpendicular\n to the line itself. A positive value means that the leader lines appear in the direction that is clockwise\n when traversing the line from its starting point to its ending point (as specified by PdfName.L (see getLine());\n a negative value indicates the opposite direction.\n\nReturns:\na float specifying the length of leader lines in default user space.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfLineAnnotation.html
PdfLineAnnotation setLeaderLineLength	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsetLeaderLineLength\npublic PdfLineAnnotation setLeaderLineLength(float leaderLineLength)\nSets the length of leader lines in default user space that extend from each endpoint of the line perpendicular\n to the line itself. A positive value means that the leader lines appear in the direction that is clockwise\n when traversing the line from its starting point to its ending point (as specified by PdfName.L (see getLine());\n a negative value indicates the opposite direction.\n\nParameters:\nleaderLineLength - a float specifying the length of leader lines in default user space.\nReturns:\nthis PdfLineAnnotation instance.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfLineAnnotation.html

PdfLineAnnotation getContentsAsCaption	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ngetContentsAsCaption\npublic boolean getContentsAsCaption()\nIf true, the text specified by the PdfName.Contents or PdfName.RC entries\n (see PdfAnnotation.getContents() and PdfMarkupAnnotation.getRichText())\n is replicated as a caption in the appearance of the line.\n\nReturns:\ntrue, if the annotation text is replicated as a caption, false otherwise. PdfLineAnnotation getCaptionPosition	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ngetCaptionPosition\npublic PdfName getCaptionPosition()\nA name describing the annotation's caption positioning. Valid values are PdfName.Inline, meaning the caption\n is centered inside the line, and PdfName.Top, meaning the caption is on top of the line.\n\nReturns:\na name describing the annotation's caption positioning, or null if the caption positioning is not\n explicitly defined (in this case the default value is used, which is PdfName.Inline).\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfLineAnnotation.html

PdfLineAnnotation getCaptionOffset	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ngetCaptionOffset\npublic PdfArray getCaptionOffset()\nAn array of two numbers that specifies the offset of the caption text from its normal position.\n The first value is the horizontal offset along the annotation line from its midpoint, with a positive value\n indicating offset to the right and a negative value indicating offset to the left. The second value is the vertical\n offset perpendicular to the annotation line, with a positive value indicating a shift up and a negative value indicating\n a shift down.\n\nReturns:\na PdfArray of two numbers that specifies the offset of the caption text from its normal position,\n or null if caption offset is not explicitly specified (in this case a default value is used, which is [0, 0]).\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfLineAnnotation.html
PdfLineAnnotation setCaptionOffset	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsetCaptionOffset\npublic PdfLineAnnotation setCaptionOffset(PdfArray captionOffset)\nSets the offset of the caption text from its normal position.\n\nParameters:\ncaptionOffset - a PdfArray of two numbers that specifies the offset of the caption text from its\n                      normal position. The first value defines the horizontal offset along the annotation line from\n                      its midpoint, with a positive value indicating offset to the right and a negative value indicating\n                      offset to the left. The second value defines the vertical offset perpendicular to the annotation line,\n                      with a positive value indicating a shift up and a negative value indicating a shift down.\nReturns:\nthis PdfLineAnnotation instance.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfLineAnnotation.html
PdfLineAnnotation	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The purpose of a line annotation is to display a single straight line on the page.\n When opened, it displays a pop-up window containing the text of the associated note.\n See also ISO-320001 12.5.6.7 "Line Annotations".</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfLineAnnotation.html

PdfMarkupAnnotation getOpacity	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ngetOpacity\npublic PdfNumber getOpacity()\nThe constant opacity value that will be used in painting the annotation.\n This value is applied to all visible elements of the annotation in its closed state\n (including its background and border) but not to the pop-up window that appears when\n the annotation is opened. Default value: 1.0.\n\nReturns:\na PdfNumber which value is in range between 0 and 1, which specifies the\n level of opacity. This method returns null if opacity is not specified; in this case default\n value is used, which is 1.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfMarkupAnnotation.html

PdfMarkupAnnotation getReplyType	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ngetReplyType\npublic PdfName getReplyType()\nA name specifying the relationship (the âreply typeâ) between this annotation and one specified by IRT entry\n (see getInReplyTo()). Valid values are:\n \nPdfName.R - The annotation shall be considered a reply to the annotation specified by IRT.\n     Conforming readers shall not display replies to an annotation individually but together in the form of\n     threaded comments.\nPdfName.Group - The annotation shall be grouped with the annotation specified by IRT.\n\n\nReturns:\na PdfName specifying relationship with the specified by the IRT entry; or null if reply\n type is not specified, in this case the default value is PdfName.R.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfMarkupAnnotation.html

PdfMarkupAnnotation setIntent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsetIntent\npublic PdfMarkupAnnotation setIntent(PdfName intent)\nSets a name describing the intent of the markup annotation.\n Intents allow conforming readers to distinguish between different uses and behaviors\n of a single markup annotation type. If this entry is not present or its value is the same as the annotation type,\n the annotation shall have no explicit intent and should behave in a generic manner in a conforming reader.\n \n See ISO-320001, free text annotations (Table 174), line annotations (Table 175), polygon annotations (Table 178),\n and polyline annotations (Table 178) for the specific intent values for those types.\n \n\nParameters:\nintent - a PdfName describing the intent of the markup annotation.\nReturns:\nthis PdfMarkupAnnotation instance.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfMarkupAnnotation.html
PdfMarkupAnnotation getExternalData	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ngetExternalData\npublic PdfDictionary getExternalData()\nAn external data dictionary specifying data that shall be associated with the annotation.\n This dictionary contains the following entries:\n \nPdfName.Type - (optional) If present, shall be PdfName.ExData.\nPdfName.Subtype - (required) a name specifying the type of data that the markup annotation\n     shall be associated with. The only defined value is PdfName.Markup3D. Table 298 (ISO-320001)\n     lists the values that correspond to a subtype of Markup3D (See also Pdf3DAnnotation).\n\n\nReturns:\nAn external data PdfDictionary, or null if not specified.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfMarkupAnnotation.html
PdfMarkupAnnotation setExternalData	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsetExternalData\npublic PdfMarkupAnnotation setExternalData(PdfName exData)\nSets an external data dictionary specifying data that shall be associated with the annotation.\n This dictionary should contain the following entries:\n \nPdfName.Type - (optional) If present, shall be PdfName.ExData.\nPdfName.Subtype - (required) a name specifying the type of data that the markup annotation\n     shall be associated with. The only defined value is PdfName.Markup3D. Table 298 (ISO-320001)\n     lists the values that correspond to a subtype of Markup3D (See also Pdf3DAnnotation).\n\n\nReturns:\nthis PdfMarkupAnnotation instance.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfMarkupAnnotation.html
PdfMarkupAnnotation setRectangleDifferences	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsetRectangleDifferences\npublic PdfMarkupAnnotation setRectangleDifferences(PdfArray rect)\nA set of four numbers describing the numerical differences between two rectangles:\n the Rect entry of the annotation and another rectangle within that one, which\n meaning depends on the type of the annotation:\n \n for PdfFreeTextAnnotation the inner rectangle is where the annotation's text should be displayed;\n\n         for PdfSquareAnnotation and PdfCircleAnnotation the inner rectangle is the actual boundaries\n         of the underlying square or circle;\n     \n for PdfCaretAnnotation the inner rectangle is the actual boundaries of the underlying caret.\n\n\nParameters:\nrect - a PdfArray with four numbers which correspond to the differences in default user space between\n             the left, top, right, and bottom coordinates of Rect and those of the inner rectangle, respectively.\n             Each value shall be greater than or equal to 0. The sum of the top and bottom differences shall be\n             less than the height of Rect, and the sum of the left and right differences shall be less than\n             the width of Rect.\nReturns:\nthis PdfMarkupAnnotation instance.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfMarkupAnnotation.html
PdfMarkupAnnotation getRectangleDifferences	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ngetRectangleDifferences\npublic PdfArray getRectangleDifferences()\nA set of four numbers describing the numerical differences between two rectangles:\n the Rect entry of the annotation and another rectangle within that one, which\n meaning depends on the type of the annotation (see setRectangleDifferences(PdfArray)).\n\nReturns:\nnull if not specified, otherwise a PdfArray with four numbers which correspond to the\n differences in default user space between the left, top, right, and bottom coordinates of Rect and those\n of the inner rectangle, respectively.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfMarkupAnnotation.html

PdfMarkupAnnotation getInteriorColor	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ngetInteriorColor\npublic Color getInteriorColor()\nThe interior color which is used to fill areas specific for different types of annotation. For PdfLineAnnotation\n and polyline annotation (PdfPolyGeomAnnotation - the annotation's line endings, for PdfSquareAnnotation\n and PdfCircleAnnotation - the annotation's rectangle or ellipse, for PdfRedactAnnotation - the redacted\n region after the affected content has been removed.\n\nReturns:\nColor of either DeviceGray, DeviceRgb or DeviceCmyk type which defines\n interior color of the annotation, or null if interior color is not specified.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfMarkupAnnotation.html
PdfMarkupAnnotation setInteriorColor	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsetInteriorColor\npublic PdfMarkupAnnotation setInteriorColor(PdfArray interiorColor)\nAn array of numbers in the range 0.0 to 1.0 specifying the interior color which is used to fill areas specific\n for different types of annotation. For PdfLineAnnotation and polyline annotation (PdfPolyGeomAnnotation -\n the annotation's line endings, for PdfSquareAnnotation and PdfCircleAnnotation - the annotation's\n rectangle or ellipse, for PdfRedactAnnotation - the redacted region after the affected content has been removed.\n\nParameters:\ninteriorColor - a PdfArray of numbers in the range 0.0 to 1.0. The number of array elements determines\n                      the colour space in which the colour is defined: 0 - No colour, transparent; 1 - DeviceGray,\n                      3 - DeviceRGB, 4 - DeviceCMYK. For the PdfRedactAnnotation number of elements shall be\n                      equal to 3 (which defines DeviceRGB colour space).\nReturns:\nthis PdfMarkupAnnotation instance.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfMarkupAnnotation.html

PdfMarkupAnnotation getIconName	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ngetIconName\npublic PdfName getIconName()\nThe name of an icon that is used in displaying the annotation. Possible values are different for different\n annotation types. PdfMarkupAnnotation setIconName	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsetIconName\npublic PdfMarkupAnnotation setIconName(PdfName name)\nThe name of an icon that is used in displaying the annotation.\n\nParameters:\nname - a PdfName that specifies the icon for displaying annotation. Possible values are different\n             for different annotation types:\n             \nPdfTextAnnotation - Comment, Key, Note, Help, NewParagraph, Paragraph, Insert;\nPdfStampAnnotation - Approved, Experimental, NotApproved, AsIs, Expired, NotForPublicRelease,\n                      Confidential, Final, Sold, Departmental, ForComment, TopSecret, Draft, ForPublicRelease.\nPdfFileAttachmentAnnotation - GraphPushPin, PaperclipTag. PdfPKCS7 setExternalDigest	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsetExternalDigest\npublic void setExternalDigest(byte[] digest,\n                              byte[] RSAdata,\n                              String digestEncryptionAlgorithm)\nSets the digest/signature to an external calculated value.\n\nParameters:\ndigest - the digest. This is the actual signature\nRSAdata - the extra data that goes into the data tag in PKCS#7\ndigestEncryptionAlgorithm - the encryption algorithm. It may must be null if the digest\n                                  is also null. If the digest is not null\n                                  then it may be "RSA" or "DSA"\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfPKCS7.html

PdfPKCS7 getEncodedPKCS7	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ngetEncodedPKCS7\npublic byte[] getEncodedPKCS7(byte[] secondDigest)\nGets the bytes for the PKCS7SignedData object. Optionally the authenticatedAttributes\n in the signerInfo can also be set. If either of the parameters is null, none will be used.\n\nParameters:\nsecondDigest - the digest in the authenticatedAttributes\nReturns:\nthe bytes for the PKCS7SignedData object\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfPKCS7.html
PdfPKCS7 getEncodedPKCS7	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ngetEncodedPKCS7\npublic byte[] getEncodedPKCS7(byte[] secondDigest,\n                              ITSAClient tsaClient,\n                              byte[] ocsp,\n                              Collection<byte[]> crlBytes,\n                              PdfSigner.CryptoStandard sigtype)\nGets the bytes for the PKCS7SignedData object. Optionally the authenticatedAttributes\n in the signerInfo can also be set, OR a time-stamp-authority client\n may be provided.\n\nParameters:\nsecondDigest - the digest in the authenticatedAttributes\ntsaClient - TSAClient - null or an optional time stamp authority client\nReturns:\nbyte[] the bytes for the PKCS7SignedData object\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfPKCS7.html
PdfPKCS7 getAuthenticatedAttributeBytes	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ngetAuthenticatedAttributeBytes\npublic byte[] getAuthenticatedAttributeBytes(byte[] secondDigest,\n                                             byte[] ocsp,\n                                             Collection<byte[]> crlBytes,\n                                             PdfSigner.CryptoStandard sigtype)\nWhen using authenticatedAttributes the authentication process is different.\n The document digest is generated and put inside the attribute. The signing is done over the DER encoded\n authenticatedAttributes. This method provides that encoding and the parameters must be\n exactly the same as in getEncodedPKCS7(byte[]).\n \n A simple example:\n \n\n Calendar cal = Calendar.getInstance();\n PdfPKCS7 pk7 = new PdfPKCS7(key, chain, null, "SHA1", null, false);\n MessageDigest messageDigest = MessageDigest.getInstance("SHA1");\n byte[] buf = new byte[8192];\n int n;\n InputStream inp = sap.getRangeStream();\n while ((n = inp.read(buf)) > 0) {\n    messageDigest.update(buf, 0, n);\n }\n byte[] hash = messageDigest.digest();\n byte[] sh = pk7.getAuthenticatedAttributeBytes(hash, cal);\n pk7.update(sh, 0, sh.length);\n byte[] sg = pk7.getEncodedPKCS7(hash, cal);\n \n\nParameters:\nsecondDigest - the content digest\nReturns:\nthe byte array representation of the authenticatedAttributes ready to be signed\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfPKCS7.html
PdfPKCS7 verify	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nverify\npublic boolean verify()\n               throws GeneralSecurityException\nVerify the digest.\n\nReturns:\ntrue if the signature checks out, false otherwise\nThrows:\nSignatureException - on error\nGeneralSecurityException\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfPKCS7.html

PdfShading.CoonsPatchMesh CoonsPatchMesh	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nCoonsPatchMesh\npublic CoonsPatchMesh(PdfColorSpace cs,\n                      int bitsPerCoordinate,\n                      int bitsPerComponent,\n                      int bitsPerFlag,\n                      float[] decode)\nCreates the new instance of the class.\n\nParameters:\ncs - the PdfColorSpace object in which colour values shall be expressed.\n           The special Pattern space isn't excepted.\nbitsPerCoordinate - the number of bits used to represent each vertex coordinate.\n                          The value shall be 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 16, 24, or 32.\nbitsPerComponent - the number of bits used to represent each colour component.\n                         The value shall be 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, or 16.\nbitsPerFlag - the number of bits used to represent the edge flag for each vertex.\n                    The value of BitsPerFlag shall be 2, 4, or 8,\n                    but only the least significant 2 bits in each flag value shall be used.\n                    The value for the edge flag shall be 0, 1, 2 or 3.\ndecode - the int[] of numbers specifying how to map vertex coordinates and colour components\n               into the appropriate ranges of values. The ranges shall be specified as follows:\n               [x_min x_max y_min y_max c1_min c1_max â¦ cn_min cn_max].\n               Only one pair of color values shall be specified if a Function entry is present.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfShading.CoonsPatchMesh.html

PdfShading.CoonsPatchMesh	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The class that extends PdfShading class and is in charge of Shading Dictionary with\n Coons Patch mesh type.\n\n This type of shading is constructed from one or more colour patches, each bounded by four cubic BÃ©zier curves.\n Degenerate BÃ©zier curves are allowed and are useful for certain graphical effects.\n At least one complete patch shall be specified.\n\n The shape of patch is defined by 12 control points.\n\n Colours are specified for each corner of the unit square,\n and bilinear interpolation is used to fill in colours over the entire unit square.\n\n Coordinates are mapped from the unit square into a four-sided patch whose sides are not necessarily linear.\n The mapping is continuous: the corners of the unit square map to corners of the patch\n and the sides of the unit square map to sides of the patch.\n\n For the format of data stream, that defines patches Table 85.\n\n If the shading dictionary contains a Function entry, the colour data for each corner of a patch\n shall be specified by a single parametric value t rather than by n separate colour components c1â¦cn.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfShading.CoonsPatchMesh.html

PdfShading.FreeFormGouraudShadedTriangleMesh	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The class that extends PdfShading class and is in charge of Shading Dictionary with\n free-form Gouraud-shaded triangle mesh type.\n\n The area to be shaded is defined by a path composed entirely of triangles.\n The colour at each vertex of the triangles is specified,\n and a technique known as Gouraud interpolation is used to colour the interiors.\n\n The object shall be represented as stream containing a sequence of vertex data.\n Each vertex is specified by the following values, in the order shown:\n f x y c1 â¦ cn where:\n f -  the vertexâs edge flag, that determines the vertex is connected to other vertices of the triangle mesh.\n      For full description Paragph 8.7.4.5.5\n x, y - vertexâs horizontal and vertical coordinates, expressed in the shadingâs target coordinate space.\n c1â¦cn - vertexâs colour components.\n\n If the shading dictionary includes a Function entry, only a single parametric value, t,\n shall be specified for each vertex in place of the colour components c1â¦cn.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfShading.FreeFormGouraudShadedTriangleMesh.html

PdfShading flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nflush\npublic void flush()\nTo manually flush a PdfObject behind this wrapper, you have to ensure\n that this object is added to the document, i.e. it has an indirect reference.\n Basically this means that before flushing you need to explicitly call PdfObjectWrapper.makeIndirect(PdfDocument).\n For example: wrapperInstance.makeIndirect(document).flush();\n Note that not every wrapper require this, only those that have such warning in documentation.\n\nOverrides:\nflush in class PdfObjectWrapper<PdfDictionary>\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfShading.html

PdfShading.LatticeFormGouraudShadedTriangleMesh LatticeFormGouraudShadedTriangleMesh	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nLatticeFormGouraudShadedTriangleMesh\npublic LatticeFormGouraudShadedTriangleMesh(PdfColorSpace cs,\n                                            int bitsPerCoordinate,\n                                            int bitsPerComponent,\n                                            int verticesPerRow,\n                                            float[] decode)\nCreates the new instance of the class.\n\nParameters:\ncs - the PdfColorSpace object in which colour values shall be expressed.\n           The special Pattern space isn't excepted.\nbitsPerCoordinate - the number of bits used to represent each vertex coordinate.\n                          The value shall be 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 16, 24, or 32.\nbitsPerComponent - the number of bits used to represent each colour component.\n                         The value shall be 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, or 16.\nverticesPerRow - the number of vertices in each row of the lattice (shall be > 1).\n                       The number of rows need not be specified.\ndecode - the int[] of numbers specifying how to map vertex coordinates and colour components\n               into the appropriate ranges of values. The ranges shall be specified as follows:\n               [x_min x_max y_min y_max c1_min c1_max â¦ cn_min cn_max].\n               Only one pair of color values shall be specified if a Function entry is present.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfShading.LatticeFormGouraudShadedTriangleMesh.html

PdfShading.LatticeFormGouraudShadedTriangleMesh	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The class that extends PdfShading class and is in charge of Shading Dictionary with\n lattice-form Gouraud-shaded triangle mesh type.\n\n This type is similar to PdfShading.FreeFormGouraudShadedTriangleMesh but instead of using free-form geometry,\n the vertices are arranged in a pseudorectangular lattice,\n which is topologically equivalent to a rectangular grid.\n The vertices are organized into rows, which need not be geometrically linear.\n\n The verticals data in stream is similar to PdfShading.FreeFormGouraudShadedTriangleMesh,\n except there is no edge flag.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfShading.LatticeFormGouraudShadedTriangleMesh.html

PdfShading.Radial Radial	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nRadial\npublic Radial(PdfColorSpace cs,\n              float x0,\n              float y0,\n              float r0,\n              float[] color0,\n              float x1,\n              float y1,\n              float r1,\n              float[] color1)\nCreates the new instance of the class.         *\n\nParameters:\ncs - the PdfColorSpace object in which colour values shall be expressed.\n           The Indexed color space isn't excepted.\nx0 - the X coordinate of starting circle's centre, expressed in in the shadingâs target coordinate space.\ny0 - the Y coordinate of starting circle's centre, expressed in in the shadingâs target coordinate space.\nr0 - the radius of starting circle's centre, should be greater or equal to 0.\n           If 0 then starting circle is treated as point.\n           If both radii are 0, nothing shall be painted.\ncolor0 - the float[] that represents the color in the start circle.\nx1 - the X coordinate of ending circle's centre, expressed in in the shadingâs target coordinate space.\ny1 - the Y coordinate of ending circle's centre, expressed in in the shadingâs target coordinate space.\nr1 - the radius of ending circle's centre, should be greater or equal to 0.\n           If 0 then ending circle is treated as point.\n           If both radii are 0, nothing shall be painted.\ncolor1 - the float[] that represents the color in the end circle.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfShading.Radial.html
PdfShading.Radial Radial	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nRadial\npublic Radial(PdfColorSpace cs,\n              float x0,\n              float y0,\n              float r0,\n              float[] color0,\n              float x1,\n              float y1,\n              float r1,\n              float[] color1,\n              boolean[] extend)\nCreates the new instance of the class.         *\n\nParameters:\ncs - the PdfColorSpace object in which colour values shall be expressed.\n           The Indexed color space isn't excepted.\nx0 - the X coordinate of starting circle's centre, expressed in in the shadingâs target coordinate space.\ny0 - the Y coordinate of starting circle's centre, expressed in in the shadingâs target coordinate space.\nr0 - the radius of starting circle's centre, should be greater or equal to 0.\n           If 0 then starting circle is treated as point.\n           If both radii are 0, nothing shall be painted.\ncolor0 - the float[] that represents the color in the start circle.\nx1 - the X coordinate of ending circle's centre, expressed in in the shadingâs target coordinate space.\ny1 - the Y coordinate of ending circle's centre, expressed in in the shadingâs target coordinate space.\nr1 - the radius of ending circle's centre, should be greater or equal to 0.\n           If 0 then ending circle is treated as point.\n           If both radii are 0, nothing shall be painted.\ncolor1 - the float[] that represents the color in the end circle.\nextend - the array of two boolean that specified whether to extend the shading\n               beyond the starting and ending points of the axis, respectively.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfShading.Radial.html
PdfShading.Radial getCoords	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ngetCoords\npublic PdfArray getCoords()\nGets the coords PdfArray object - an array of six numbers [x0 y0 r0 x1 y1 r1],\n specifying the centres and radii of the starting and ending circles,\n expressed in the shadingâs target coordinate space.\n The radii r0 and r1 shall both be greater than or equal to 0.\n If one radius is 0, the corresponding circle shall be treated as a point;\n if both are 0, nothing shall be painted.\n\nReturns:\nthe PdfArray coords object.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfShading.Radial.html

PdfShading.TensorProductPatchMesh TensorProductPatchMesh	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nTensorProductPatchMesh\npublic TensorProductPatchMesh(PdfColorSpace cs,\n                              int bitsPerCoordinate,\n                              int bitsPerComponent,\n                              int bitsPerFlag,\n                              float[] decode)\nCreates the new instance of the class.\n\nParameters:\ncs - the PdfColorSpace object in which colour values shall be expressed.\n           The special Pattern space isn't excepted.\nbitsPerCoordinate - the number of bits used to represent each vertex coordinate.\n                          The value shall be 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 16, 24, or 32.\nbitsPerComponent - the number of bits used to represent each colour component.\n                         The value shall be 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, or 16.\nbitsPerFlag - the number of bits used to represent the edge flag for each vertex.\n                    The value of BitsPerFlag shall be 2, 4, or 8,\n                    but only the least significant 2 bits in each flag value shall be used.\n                    The value for the edge flag shall be 0, 1, 2 or 3.\ndecode - the int[] of numbers specifying how to map vertex coordinates and colour components\n               into the appropriate ranges of values. The ranges shall be specified as follows:\n               [x_min x_max y_min y_max c1_min c1_max â¦ cn_min cn_max].\n               Only one pair of color values shall be specified if a Function entry is present.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfShading.TensorProductPatchMesh.html

PdfShading.TensorProductPatchMesh	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The class that extends PdfShading class and is in charge of Shading Dictionary with\n Tensor-Product Patch mesh type.\n\n This type of shading is identical to PdfShading.CoonsPatchMesh, except that it's based on a\n bicubic tensor-product patch defined by 16 control points.\n\n For the format of data stream, that defines patches Table 86.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfShading.TensorProductPatchMesh.html

PdfSigFieldLockDictionary.LockPermissions	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Enumerates the different levels of access permissions granted for\n the document when the corresponding signature field is signed:\n \nNO_CHANGES_ALLOWED - no changes to the document are\n     permitted; any change to the document invalidates the signature,\nFORM_FILLING - permitted changes are filling in forms,\n     instantiating page templates, and signing; other changes invalidate\n     the signature,\nFORM_FILLING_AND_ANNOTATION - permitted changes are the\n     same as for the previous, as well as annotation creation, deletion,\n     and modification; other changes invalidate the signature.\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfSigFieldLockDictionary.LockPermissions.html

PdfSigner getSignatureAppearance	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ngetSignatureAppearance\npublic PdfSignatureAppearance getSignatureAppearance()\nProvides access to a signature appearance object. Use it to\n customize the appearance of the signature.\n \n Be aware:\n \nIf you create new signature field (either use setFieldName(java.lang.String) with\n the name that doesn't exist in the document or don't specify it at all) then\n the signature is invisible by default.\nIf you sign already existing field, then the signature appearance object\n is modified to have all the properties (page num., rect etc.) consistent with\n the state of the field (if you customized the appearance object\n before the setFieldName(java.lang.String) call you'll have to do it again)\n\n\n\nReturns:\nPdfSignatureAppearance object.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfSigner.html

PdfSigner signDetached	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsignDetached\npublic void signDetached(IExternalDigest externalDigest,\n                         IExternalSignature externalSignature,\n                         Certificate[] chain,\n                         Collection<ICrlClient> crlList,\n                         IOcspClient ocspClient,\n                         ITSAClient tsaClient,\n                         int estimatedSize,\n                         PdfSigner.CryptoStandard sigtype)\n                  throws IOException,\n                         GeneralSecurityException\nSigns the document using the detached mode, CMS or CAdES equivalent.\n \n NOTE: This method closes the underlying pdf document. This means, that current instance\n of PdfSigner cannot be used after this method call.\n\nParameters:\nexternalSignature - the interface providing the actual signing\nchain - the certificate chain\ncrlList - the CRL list\nocspClient - the OCSP client\ntsaClient - the Timestamp client\nexternalDigest - an implementation that provides the digest\nestimatedSize - the reserved size for the signature. It will be estimated if 0\nsigtype - Either Signature.CMS or Signature.CADES\nThrows:\nIOException\nGeneralSecurityException\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfSigner.html

The signature is fully composed\n externally, iText will just put the container inside the document.\n \n NOTE: This method closes the underlying pdf document. This means, that current instance\n of PdfSigner cannot be used after this method call.\n\nParameters:\nexternalSignatureContainer - the interface providing the actual signing\nestimatedSize - the reserved size for the signature\nThrows:\nGeneralSecurityException\nIOException\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfSigner.html

PdfSigner preClose	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\npreClose\nprotected void preClose(Map<PdfName,Integer> exclusionSizes)\n                 throws IOException\nThis is the first method to be called when using external signatures. The general sequence is:\n preClose(), getDocumentBytes() and close().\n \nexclusionSizes must contain at least\n the PdfName.CONTENTS key with the size that it will take in the\n document. Note that due to the hex string coding this size should be byte_size*2+2.\n\nParameters:\nexclusionSizes - Map with names and sizes to be excluded in the signature\n                       calculation. The key is a PdfName and the value an Integer. At least the /Contents must be present\nThrows:\nIOException - on error\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfSigner.html

PdfSigner close	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nclose\nprotected void close(PdfDictionary update)\n              throws IOException\nThis is the last method to be called when using external signatures. The general sequence is:\n preClose(), getDocumentBytes() and close().\n \n update is a PdfDictionary that must have exactly the\n same keys as the ones provided in preClose(Map).\n\nParameters:\nupdate - a PdfDictionary with the key/value that will fill the holes defined\n               in preClose(Map)\nThrows:\nIOException - on error\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfSigner.html

PdfStream PdfStream	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nPdfStream\npublic PdfStream(PdfDocument doc,\n                 InputStream inputStream,\n                 int compressionLevel)\nCreates an efficient stream. No temporary array is ever created. The InputStream\n is totally consumed but is not closed. The general usage is:\n \n\n PdfDocument document = ?;\n InputStream in = ?;\n PdfStream stream = new PdfStream(document, in, PdfOutputStream.DEFAULT_COMPRESSION);\n ?\n stream.flush();\n in.close();\n \n\nParameters:\ninputStream - the data to write to this stream\ncompressionLevel - the compression level (0 = best speed, 9 = best compression, -1 is default)\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfStream.html

PdfString	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A PdfString-class is the PDF-equivalent of a\n JAVA-String-object.\n \n A string is a sequence of characters delimited by parenthesis.\n If a string is too long to be conveniently placed on a single line, it may\n be split across multiple lines by using the backslash character (\) at the\n end of a line to indicate that the string continues on the following line.\n Within a string, the backslash character is used as an escape to specify\n unbalanced parenthesis, non-printing ASCII characters, and the backslash\n character itself. Use of the \ddd escape sequence is the preferred\n way to represent characters outside the printable ASCII character set.\n This object is described in the 'Portable Document Format Reference Manual\n version 1.7' section 3.2.3 (page 53-56).\n \nPdfObject</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfString.html

PdfStructElem isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nisWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect\nprotected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()\nDescription copied from class: PdfObjectWrapper\nDefines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the\n resultant document.\n \n If this method returns true it doesn't necessarily mean that object\n must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that\n when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into\n indirect object if it's not indirect yet.\n \n Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return\n always true or false.\n\nSpecified by:\nisWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect in class PdfObjectWrapper<PdfDictionary>\nReturns:\ntrue if in the resultant document the object behind the wrapper\n          must be indirect, otherwise false.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfStructElem.html

PdfTargetDictionary	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A target dictionary locates the target in relation to the source,\n in much the same way that a relative path describes the physical\n relationship between two files in a file system. PdfTextArray	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>PdfTextArray defines an array with displacements and PdfString-objects.\n \n A PdfTextArray is used with the operator TJ in PdfCanvas.\n The first object in this array has to be a PdfString;\n see reference manual version 1.3 section 8.7.5, pages 346-347.\n       OR\n see reference manual version 1.6 section 5.3.2, pages 378-379.\n To emit a more efficient array, we consolidate repeated numbers or strings into single array entries.\n "add( 50 ); add( -50 );" will REMOVE the combined zero from the array.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfTextArray.html

If the character was already defined it will return the same content\n\nParameters:\nc - the character to match this glyph.\nwx - the advance this character will have\nllx - the X lower left corner of the glyph bounding box. If the colorize option is\n            true the value is ignored\nlly - the Y lower left corner of the glyph bounding box. If the colorize option is\n            true the value is ignored\nurx - the X upper right corner of the glyph bounding box. PdfType3Font	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Low-level API class for Type 3 fonts.\n \n In Type 3 fonts, glyphs are defined by streams of PDF graphics operators.\n These streams are associated with character names. A separate encoding entry\n maps character codes to the appropriate character names for the glyphs.\n\n \n To be able to be wrapped with this PdfObjectWrapper the PdfObject\n must be indirect.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/PdfType3Font.html

RandomAccessSourceFactory createBestSource	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ncreateBestSource\npublic IRandomAccessSource createBestSource(String filename)\n                                     throws IOException\nCreates a IRandomAccessSource based on a filename string.\n If the filename describes a URL, a URL based source is created\n If the filename describes a file on disk, the contents may be read into memory (if forceRead is true),\n opened using memory mapped file channel (if usePlainRandomAccess is false), or\n opened using RandomAccessFile access (if usePlainRandomAccess is true)\n This call will automatically fail over to using RandomAccessFile if the memory map operation fails\n\nParameters:\nfilename - the name of the file or resource to create the IRandomAccessSource for\nReturns:\nthe newly created IRandomAccessSource\nThrows:\nIOException\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/RandomAccessSourceFactory.html
RandomAccessSourceFactory createBestSource	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ncreateBestSource\npublic IRandomAccessSource createBestSource(FileChannel channel)\n                                     throws IOException\nCreates a IRandomAccessSource based on memory mapping a file channel.\n Unless you are explicitly working with a FileChannel already, it is better to use\n createBestSource(String).\n If the file is large, it will be opened using a paging strategy.\n\nParameters:\nchannel - the name of the file or resource to create the IRandomAccessSource for\nReturns:\nthe newly created IRandomAccessSource\nThrows:\nIOException\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/RandomAccessSourceFactory.html

RoundDotsBorder draw	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ndraw\npublic void draw(PdfCanvas canvas,\n                 float x1,\n                 float y1,\n                 float x2,\n                 float y2,\n                 float borderWidthBefore,\n                 float borderWidthAfter)\n\n All borders are supposed to be drawn in such way, that inner content of the element is on the right from the\n drawing direction. Borders are drawn in this order: top, right, bottom, left.\n \n\n Given points specify the line which lies on the border of the content area,\n therefore the border itself should be drawn to the left from the drawing direction.\n \n\nborderWidthBefore and borderWidthAfter parameters are used to\n define the widths of the borders that are before and after the current border, e.g. for\n the bottom border, borderWidthBefore specifies width of the right border and\n borderWidthAfter - width of the left border. Those width are used to handle areas\n of border joins.\n \n\nSpecified by:\ndraw in class Border\nParameters:\ncanvas - PdfCanvas to be written to\nx1 - x coordinate of the beginning point of the element side, that should be bordered\ny1 - y coordinate of the beginning point of the element side, that should be bordered\nx2 - x coordinate of the ending point of the element side, that should be bordered\ny2 - y coordinate of the ending point of the element side, that should be bordered\nborderWidthBefore - defines width of the border that is before the current one\nborderWidthAfter - defines width of the border that is after the current one\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/RoundDotsBorder.html

SolidBorder draw	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ndraw\npublic void draw(PdfCanvas canvas,\n                 float x1,\n                 float y1,\n                 float x2,\n                 float y2,\n                 float borderWidthBefore,\n                 float borderWidthAfter)\n\n All borders are supposed to be drawn in such way, that inner content of the element is on the right from the\n drawing direction. Borders are drawn in this order: top, right, bottom, left.\n \n\n Given points specify the line which lies on the border of the content area,\n therefore the border itself should be drawn to the left from the drawing direction.\n \n\nborderWidthBefore and borderWidthAfter parameters are used to\n define the widths of the borders that are before and after the current border, e.g. for\n the bottom border, borderWidthBefore specifies width of the right border and\n borderWidthAfter - width of the left border. Those width are used to handle areas\n of border joins.\n \n\nSpecified by:\ndraw in class Border\nParameters:\ncanvas - PdfCanvas to be written to\nx1 - x coordinate of the beginning point of the element side, that should be bordered\ny1 - y coordinate of the beginning point of the element side, that should be bordered\nx2 - x coordinate of the ending point of the element side, that should be bordered\ny2 - y coordinate of the ending point of the element side, that should be bordered\nborderWidthBefore - defines width of the border that is before the current one\nborderWidthAfter - defines width of the border that is after the current one\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/SolidBorder.html

Style setSpacingRatio	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsetSpacingRatio\npublic Style setSpacingRatio(float ratio)\nSets a ratio which determines in which proportion will word spacing and character spacing\n be applied when horizontal alignment is justified.\n\nParameters:\nratio - the ratio coefficient. It must be between 0 and 1, inclusive.\n              It means that ratio part of the free space will\n              be compensated by word spacing, and 1-ratio part of the free space will\n              be compensated by character spacing.\n              If ratio is 1, additional character spacing will not be applied.\n              If ratio is 0, additional word spacing will not be applied.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/Style.html

Table isComplete	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nisComplete\npublic boolean isComplete()\nDescription copied from interface: ILargeElement\nChecks whether an element has already been marked as complete.\n\nSpecified by:\nisComplete in interface ILargeElement\nReturns:\nthe completion marker boolean\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/Table.html
Table complete	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ncomplete\npublic void complete()\nIndicates that all the desired content has been added to this large element.\n After this method is called, more precise rendering is activated.\n For instance, a table may have a setSkipLastFooter(boolean) method set to true,\n and in case of large table on flush() we do not know if any more content will be added,\n so we might not place the content in the bottom of the page where it would fit, but instead add a footer, and\n place that content in the start of the page. Technically such result would look all right, but it would be\n more concise if we placed the content in the bottom and did not start new page. For such cases to be\n renderered more accurately, one can call complete() when some content is still there and not flushed.\n\nSpecified by:\ncomplete in interface ILargeElement\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/Table.html
Table flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nflush\npublic void flush()\nWrites the newly added content to the document.\n\nSpecified by:\nflush in interface ILargeElement\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/Table.html
Table flushContent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nflushContent\npublic void flushContent()\nFlushes the content which has just been added to the document.\n This is a method for internal usage and is called automatically by the docunent.\n\nSpecified by:\nflushContent in interface ILargeElement\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/Table.html

TagStructureContext flushPageTags	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nflushPageTags\npublic TagStructureContext flushPageTags(PdfPage page)\nFlushes the tags which are considered to belong to the given page.\n The logic that defines if the given tag (structure element) belongs to the page is the following:\n if all the marked content references (dictionary or number references), that are the\n descenders of the given structure element, belong to the current page - the tag is considered\n to belong to the page. If tag has descenders from several pages - it is flushed, if all other pages except the\n current one are flushed.\n\n \n If some of the page's tags are still connected to the accessible elements, in this case these tags are considered\n as not yet finished ones, and they won't be flushed.\n\nParameters:\npage - a page which tags will be flushed.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/TagStructureContext.html
TagStructureContext normalizeDocumentRootTag	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nnormalizeDocumentRootTag\npublic void normalizeDocumentRootTag()\nTransforms root tags in a way that complies with the PDF References.\n\n \n PDF Reference\n 10.7.3 Grouping Elements:\n\n \n For most content extraction formats, the document must be a tree with a single top-level element;\n the structure tree root (identified by the StructTreeRoot entry in the document catalog) must have\n only one child in its K (kids) array. If the PDF file contains a complete document, the structure\n type Document is recommended for this top-level element in the logical structure hierarchy. If the\n file contains a well-formed document fragment, one of the structure types Part, Art, Sect, or Div\n may be used instead.\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/TagStructureContext.html
TagStructureContext	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>TagStructureContext class is used to track necessary information of document's tag structure.\n It is also used to make some global modifications of the tag tree like removing or flushing page tags, however\n these two methods and also others are called automatically and are for the most part for internal usage.\n \n There shall be only one instance of this class per PdfDocument. To obtain instance of this class use\n PdfDocument.getTagStructureContext().</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/TagStructureContext.html

TagTreePointer setContentStreamForTagging	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsetContentStreamForTagging\npublic TagTreePointer setContentStreamForTagging(PdfStream contentStream)\nSometimes, tags are desired to be connected with the content that resides not in the page's content stream,\n but rather in the some appearance stream or in the form xObject stream. In that case, to have a valid tag structure,\n one shall set not only the page, on which the content will be rendered, but also the content stream in which\n the tagged content will reside.\n \n NOTE: It's important to set a null for this value, when tagging of this stream content is finished.\n\nParameters:\ncontentStream - the content stream which content will be tagged with this instance of TagTreePointer\n                      or null if content stream tagging is finished.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/TagTreePointer.html

TagTreePointer addTag	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\naddTag\npublic TagTreePointer addTag(IAccessibleElement element,\n                             boolean keepConnectedToTag)\nAdds a new tag to the tag structure.\n This method call moves this TagTreePointer to the added kid.\n \n New tag will have a role and attributes defined by the given IAccessibleElement.\n \n If keepConnectedToTag is true then a newly created tag will retain the connection with given\n accessible element. See moveToTag(com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils.IAccessibleElement) for more explanations about tag connections concept.\n \n If the same accessible element is connected to the tag and is added twice to the same parent -\n this TagTreePointer instance would move to connected kid instead of creating tag twice.\n But if it is added to some other parent, then connection will be removed.\n\nParameters:\nelement - accessible element which represents a new tag.\nkeepConnectedToTag - defines if to retain the connection between accessible element and the tag.\nReturns:\nthis TagTreePointer instance.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/TagTreePointer.html

TagTreePointer setNextNewKidIndex	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsetNextNewKidIndex\npublic TagTreePointer setNextNewKidIndex(int nextNewKidIndex)\nSets index of the next added to the current tag kid, which could be another tag or content item.\n By default, new tag is added at the end of the parent kids array. This property affects only the next added tag,\n all tags added after will be added with the default behaviour.\n \n This method could be used with any overload of addTag(PdfName) method,\n with relocateKid(int, TagTreePointer) and addAnnotationTag(PdfAnnotation).\n \n Keep in mind, that this method set property to the TagTreePointer and not to the tag itself, which means\n that if you would move the pointer, this property would be applied to the new current tag.\n\nParameters:\nnextNewKidIndex - index of the next added kid.\nReturns:\nthis TagTreePointer instance.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/TagTreePointer.html

TagTreePointer getRole	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ngetRole\npublic PdfName getRole()\nGets current tag role.\n\nReturns:\ncurrent tag role.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/TagTreePointer.html
TagTreePointer	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>TagTreePointer class is used to modify the document's tag tree. At any given moment, instance of this class\n 'points' at the specific position in the tree (at the specific tag). For the current tag you can add new tags, modify\n it's role and properties, etc. Also, using instance of this class, you can change tag position in the tag structure,\n you can flush current tag or remove it.\n \n\n There could be any number of the instances of this class, simultaneously pointing to different (or the same) parts of\n the tag structure. Because of this, you can for example remove the tag at which another instance is currently pointing.\n In this case, this another instance becomes invalid, and invocation of any method on it will result in exception. To make\n given instance valid again, use moveToRoot() method.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/TagTreePointer.html

TernaryTree sc	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsc\nprotected char[] sc\nThe character stored in this node: splitchar.\n Two special values are reserved:\n0x0000 as string terminator\n0xFFFF to indicate that the branch starting at\n this node is compressed\nThis shouldn't be a problem if we give the usual semantics to\n strings since 0xFFFF is garanteed not to be an Unicode character.\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/TernaryTree.html
