XMPMetaImpl iterator	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\niterator\npublic XMPIterator iterator(String schemaNS,\n                            String propName,\n                            IteratorOptions options)\n                     throws XMPException\nDescription copied from interface: XMPMeta\nConstruct an iterator for the properties within an XMP object. According to the parameters it iterates the entire data tree,\n properties within a specific schema, or a subtree rooted at a specific node.\n\nSpecified by:\niterator in interface XMPMeta\nParameters:\nschemaNS - Optional schema namespace URI to restrict the iteration. Omitted (visit all\n        schema) by passing null or empty String.\npropName - Optional property name to restrict the iteration. May be an arbitrary path\n        expression. Omitted (visit all properties) by passing null or empty\n        String. If no schema URI is given, it is ignored.\noptions - Option flags to control the iteration. See IteratorOptions for\n        details.\nReturns:\nReturns an XMPIterator for this XMPMeta-object\n         considering the given options.\nThrows:\nXMPException - Wraps all errors and exceptions that may occur.\nSee Also:\nXMPMeta.iterator(String, String, IteratorOptions)\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/XMPMetaImpl.html
XMPMetaImpl setArrayItem	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsetArrayItem\npublic void setArrayItem(String schemaNS,\n                         String arrayName,\n                         int itemIndex,\n                         String itemValue,\n                         PropertyOptions options)\n                  throws XMPException\nDescription copied from interface: XMPMeta\nReplaces an item within an array. The index is passed as an integer, you need not worry about\n the path string syntax for array items, convert a loop index to a string, etc. The array\n passed must already exist. In normal usage the selected array item is modified. A new item is\n automatically appended if the index is the array size plus 1.\n\nSpecified by:\nsetArrayItem in interface XMPMeta\nParameters:\nschemaNS - The namespace URI for the array. Has the same usage as in getProperty.\narrayName - The name of the array. May be a general path expression, must not be\n        null or the empty string. Has the same namespace prefix usage as\n        propName in getProperty.\nitemIndex - The index of the desired item. Arrays in XMP are indexed from 1. To address\n        the last existing item, use XMPMeta.countArrayItems(String, String) to find\n        out the length of the array.\nitemValue - the new value of the array item. Has the same usage as propValue in\n        setProperty().\noptions - the set options for the item.\nThrows:\nXMPException\nSee Also:\nXMPMeta.setArrayItem(String, String, int, String, PropertyOptions)\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/XMPMetaImpl.html
XMPMetaImpl setArrayItem	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsetArrayItem\npublic void setArrayItem(String schemaNS,\n                         String arrayName,\n                         int itemIndex,\n                         String itemValue)\n                  throws XMPException\n\nSpecified by:\nsetArrayItem in interface XMPMeta\nParameters:\nschemaNS - The namespace URI\narrayName - The name of the array\nitemIndex - The index to insert the new item\nitemValue - the new value of the array item\nThrows:\nXMPException - Wraps all errors and exceptions\nSee Also:\nXMPMeta.setArrayItem(String, String, int, String)\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/XMPMetaImpl.html
XMPMetaImpl insertArrayItem	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ninsertArrayItem\npublic void insertArrayItem(String schemaNS,\n                            String arrayName,\n                            int itemIndex,\n                            String itemValue,\n                            PropertyOptions options)\n                     throws XMPException\nDescription copied from interface: XMPMeta\nInserts an item into an array previous to the given index. The index is passed as an integer,\n you need not worry about the path string syntax for array items, convert a loop index to a\n string, etc. The array passed must already exist. In normal usage the selected array item is\n modified. A new item is automatically appended if the index is the array size plus 1.\n\nSpecified by:\ninsertArrayItem in interface XMPMeta\nParameters:\nschemaNS - The namespace URI for the array. Has the same usage as in getProperty.\narrayName - The name of the array. May be a general path expression, must not be\n        null or the empty string. Has the same namespace prefix usage as\n        propName in getProperty.\nitemIndex - The index to insert the new item. Arrays in XMP are indexed from 1. Use\n                  XMPConst.ARRAY_LAST_ITEM to append items.\nitemValue - the new value of the array item. Has the same usage as\n        propValue in setProperty().\noptions - the set options that decide about the kind of the node.\nThrows:\nXMPException\nSee Also:\nXMPMeta.insertArrayItem(String, String, int, String,\n      PropertyOptions)\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/XMPMetaImpl.html
XMPMetaImpl insertArrayItem	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ninsertArrayItem\npublic void insertArrayItem(String schemaNS,\n                            String arrayName,\n                            int itemIndex,\n                            String itemValue)\n                     throws XMPException\n\nSpecified by:\ninsertArrayItem in interface XMPMeta\nParameters:\nschemaNS - The namespace URI for the array\narrayName - The name of the array\nitemIndex - The index to insert the new item\nitemValue - the value of the array item\nThrows:\nXMPException - Wraps all errors and exceptions\nSee Also:\nXMPMeta.insertArrayItem(String, String, int, String)\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/XMPMetaImpl.html
XMPMetaImpl setProperty	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsetProperty\npublic void setProperty(String schemaNS,\n                        String propName,\n                        Object propValue,\n                        PropertyOptions options)\n                 throws XMPException\nDescription copied from interface: XMPMeta\nThe property value setters all take a property specification, their\n differences are in the form of this. The first two parameters are always the top level\n namespace URI (the schema namespace) and the basic name of the property being\n referenced. See the introductory discussion of path expression usage for more information.\n \n All of the functions take a string value for the property and option flags describing the\n property. The value must be Unicode in UTF-8 encoding. Arrays and non-leaf levels of structs\n do not have values. Empty arrays and structs may be created using appropriate option flags.\n All levels of structs that is assigned implicitly are created if necessary. appendArayItem\n implicitly creates the named array if necessary.\n \n See PropertyOptions for detailed information about the options.\n \n This is the simplest property setter, mainly for top level simple properties or after using\n the path composition functions in XMPPathFactory.\n\nSpecified by:\nsetProperty in interface XMPMeta\nParameters:\nschemaNS - The namespace URI for the property. Has the same usage as in getProperty.\npropName - The name of the property.\n                                   Has the same usage as in getProperty().\npropValue - the value for the property (only leaf properties have a value).\n        Arrays and non-leaf levels of structs do not have values.\n        Must be null if the value is not relevant.\n        The value is automatically detected: Boolean, Integer, Long, Double, XMPDateTime and\n        byte[] are handled, on all other toString() is called.\noptions - Option flags describing the property. See the earlier description.\nThrows:\nXMPException\nSee Also:\nXMPMeta.setProperty(String, String, Object, PropertyOptions)\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/XMPMetaImpl.html
XMPMetaImpl setProperty	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsetProperty\npublic void setProperty(String schemaNS,\n                        String propName,\n                        Object propValue)\n                 throws XMPException\n\nSpecified by:\nsetProperty in interface XMPMeta\nParameters:\nschemaNS - The namespace URI\npropName - The name of the property\npropValue - the value for the property\nThrows:\nXMPException - Wraps all errors and exceptions\nSee Also:\nXMPMeta.setProperty(String, String, Object)\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/XMPMetaImpl.html
XMPMetaImpl setQualifier	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsetQualifier\npublic void setQualifier(String schemaNS,\n                         String propName,\n                         String qualNS,\n                         String qualName,\n                         String qualValue,\n                         PropertyOptions options)\n                  throws XMPException\nDescription copied from interface: XMPMeta\nProvides access to a qualifier attached to a property. The namespace for the qualifier is\n passed as a URI, you need not worry about the path string syntax. In many regards qualifiers\n are like struct fields. See the introductory discussion of qualified properties for more\n information. The names of qualifiers should be XML qualified names, that is within an XML\n namespace. The path syntax for a qualified name uses the namespace prefix, which is\n unreliable because the prefix is never guaranteed. The URI is the formal name, the prefix is\n just a local shorthand in a given sequence of XML text. The property the qualifier\n will be attached has to exist.\n\nSpecified by:\nsetQualifier in interface XMPMeta\nParameters:\nschemaNS - The namespace URI for the struct. Has the same usage as in getProperty.\npropName - The name of the property to which the qualifier is attached. Has the same\n        usage as in getProperty.\nqualNS - The namespace URI for the qualifier. Has the same URI and prefix usage as the\n        schemaNS parameter.\nqualName - The name of the qualifier. Must be a single XML name, must not be\n        null or the empty string. Has the same namespace prefix usage as the\n        propName parameter.\nqualValue - A pointer to the null terminated UTF-8 string that is the\n        value of the qualifier, if the qualifier has a value. Has the same usage as propValue\n        in getProperty.\noptions - Option flags describing the qualifier. See the earlier description.\nThrows:\nXMPException\nSee Also:\nXMPMeta.setQualifier(String, String, String, String, String,\n      PropertyOptions)\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/XMPMetaImpl.html
XMPMetaImpl setQualifier	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsetQualifier\npublic void setQualifier(String schemaNS,\n                         String propName,\n                         String qualNS,\n                         String qualName,\n                         String qualValue)\n                  throws XMPException\n\nSpecified by:\nsetQualifier in interface XMPMeta\nParameters:\nschemaNS - The namespace URI for the struct\npropName - The name of the property to which the qualifier is attached\nqualNS - The namespace URI for the qualifier\nqualName - The name of the qualifier\nqualValue - the value of the qualifier\nThrows:\nXMPException - Wraps all errors and exceptions\nSee Also:\nXMPMeta.setQualifier(String, String, String, String, String)\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/XMPMetaImpl.html
XMPMetaImpl setStructField	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsetStructField\npublic void setStructField(String schemaNS,\n                           String structName,\n                           String fieldNS,\n                           String fieldName,\n                           String fieldValue,\n                           PropertyOptions options)\n                    throws XMPException\nDescription copied from interface: XMPMeta\nProvides access to fields within a nested structure. The namespace for the field is passed as\n a URI, you need not worry about the path string syntax. The names of fields should be XML\n qualified names, that is within an XML namespace. The path syntax for a qualified name uses\n the namespace prefix, which is unreliable because the prefix is never guaranteed. The URI is\n the formal name, the prefix is just a local shorthand in a given sequence of XML text.\n\nSpecified by:\nsetStructField in interface XMPMeta\nParameters:\nschemaNS - The namespace URI for the struct. Has the same usage as in getProperty.\nstructName - The name of the struct. May be a general path expression, must not be null\n        or the empty string. Has the same namespace prefix usage as propName in getProperty.\nfieldNS - The namespace URI for the field. Has the same URI and prefix usage as the\n        schemaNS parameter.\nfieldName - The name of the field. Must be a single XML name, must not be null or the\n        empty string. Has the same namespace prefix usage as the structName parameter.\nfieldValue - the value of thefield, if the field has a value.\n        Has the same usage as propValue in getProperty.\noptions - Option flags describing the field. XMPMetaImpl sort	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nsort\npublic void sort()\nDescription copied from interface: XMPMeta\nSorts the complete datamodel according to the following rules:\n \nSchema nodes are sorted by prefix.\n                Properties at top level and within structs are sorted by full name, that is\n                        prefix + local name.\n                Array items are not sorted, even if they have no certain order such as bags.\n                Qualifier are sorted, with the exception of "xml:lang" and/or "rdf:type"\n                        that stay at the top of the list in that order.\n \n\nSpecified by:\nsort in interface XMPMeta\nSee Also:\nXMPMeta.sort()\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/XMPMetaImpl.html

XMPPathFactory composeArrayItemPath	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ncomposeArrayItemPath\npublic static String composeArrayItemPath(String arrayName,\n                                          int itemIndex)\n                                   throws XMPException\nCompose the path expression for an item in an array.\n\nParameters:\narrayName - The name of the array. May be a general path expression, must not be\n        null or the empty string.\nitemIndex - The index of the desired item. Arrays in XMP are indexed from 1.\n                  0 and below means last array item and renders as [last()].\nReturns:\nReturns the composed path basing on fullPath. This will be of the form\n         ns:arrayName[i], where "ns" is the prefix for schemaNS and\n         "i" is the decimal representation of itemIndex.\nThrows:\nXMPException - Throws exeption if index zero is used.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/XMPPathFactory.html
XMPPathFactory composeStructFieldPath	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ncomposeStructFieldPath\npublic static String composeStructFieldPath(String fieldNS,\n                                            String fieldName)\n                                     throws XMPException\nCompose the path expression for a field in a struct. The result can be added to the\n path of\n\nParameters:\nfieldNS - The namespace URI for the field. Must not be null or the empty\n        string.\nfieldName - The name of the field. Must be a simple XML name, must not be\n        null or the empty string.\nReturns:\nReturns the composed path. This will be of the form\n         ns:structName/fNS:fieldName, where "ns" is the prefix for\n         schemaNS and "fNS" is the prefix for fieldNS.\nThrows:\nXMPException - Thrown if the path to create is not valid.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/XMPPathFactory.html
XMPPathFactory composeQualifierPath	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ncomposeQualifierPath\npublic static String composeQualifierPath(String qualNS,\n                                          String qualName)\n                                   throws XMPException\nCompose the path expression for a qualifier.\n\nParameters:\nqualNS - The namespace URI for the qualifier. May be null or the empty\n        string if the qualifier is in the XML empty namespace.\nqualName - The name of the qualifier. Must be a simple XML name, must not be\n        null or the empty string.\nReturns:\nReturns the composed path. This will be of the form\n         ns:propName/?qNS:qualName, where "ns" is the prefix for\n         schemaNS and "qNS" is the prefix for qualNS.\nThrows:\nXMPException - Thrown if the path to create is not valid.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/XMPPathFactory.html
XMPPathFactory composeLangSelector	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ncomposeLangSelector\npublic static String composeLangSelector(String arrayName,\n                                         String langName)\nCompose the path expression to select an alternate item by language. The\n path syntax allows two forms of "content addressing" that may\n be used to select an item in an array of alternatives. The form used in\n ComposeLangSelector lets you select an item in an alt-text array based on\n the value of its xml:lang qualifier. The other form of content\n addressing is shown in ComposeFieldSelector. \note ComposeLangSelector\n does not supplant SetLocalizedText or GetLocalizedText. They should\n generally be used, as they provide extra logic to choose the appropriate\n language and maintain consistency with the 'x-default' value.\n ComposeLangSelector gives you an path expression that is explicitly and\n only for the language given in the langName parameter.\n\nParameters:\narrayName - The name of the array. May be a general path expression, must\n            not be null or the empty string.\nlangName - The RFC 3066 code for the desired language.\nReturns:\nReturns the composed path. This will be of the form\n         ns:arrayName[@xml:lang='langName'], where\n         "ns" is the prefix for schemaNS.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/XMPPathFactory.html
XMPPathFactory	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Utility services for the metadata object. It has only public static functions, you cannot create\n an object. These are all functions that layer cleanly on top of the kernel XMP toolkit.\n \n These functions provide support for composing path expressions to deeply nested properties. The\n functions XMPMeta such as getProperty(),\n getArrayItem() and getStructField() provide easy access to top\n level simple properties, items in top level arrays, and fields of top level structs. They do not\n provide convenient access to more complex things like fields several levels deep in a complex\n struct, or fields within an array of structs, or items of an array that is a field of a struct.\n These functions can also be used to compose paths to top level array items or struct fields so\n that you can use the binary accessors like getPropertyAsInteger().\n \n You can use these functions is to compose a complete path expression, or all but the last\n component. Suppose you have a property that is an array of integers within a struct. You can\n access one of the array items like this:\n \n\n\n      String path = XMPPathFactory.composeStructFieldPath (schemaNS, "Struct", fieldNS,\n          "Array");\n      String path += XMPPathFactory.composeArrayItemPath (schemaNS, "Array" index);\n      PropertyInteger result = xmpObj.getPropertyAsInteger(schemaNS, path);\n \n You could also use this code if you want the string form of the integer:\n \n\n      String path = XMPPathFactory.composeStructFieldPath (schemaNS, "Struct", fieldNS,\n          "Array");\n      PropertyText xmpObj.getArrayItem (schemaNS, path, index);\n \n\n\nNote: It might look confusing that the schemaNS is passed in all of the calls above.\n This is because the XMP toolkit keeps the top level "schema" namespace separate from\n the rest of the path expression.\n Note: These methods are much simpler than in the C++-API, they don't check the given\n path or array indices.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/XMPPathFactory.html
XMPPathParser	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Parser for XMP XPaths.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/XMPPathParser.html

XMPSchemaRegistry registerNamespace	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nregisterNamespace\nString registerNamespace(String namespaceURI,\n                         String suggestedPrefix)\n                  throws XMPException\nRegister a namespace URI with a suggested prefix. It is not an error if\n the URI is already registered, no matter what the prefix is. If the URI\n is not registered but the suggested prefix is in use, a unique prefix is\n created from the suggested one. The actual registeed prefix is always\n returned. The function result tells if the registered prefix is the\n suggested one.\n \n Note: No checking is presently done on either the URI or the prefix.\n\nParameters:\nnamespaceURI - The URI for the namespace. Must be a valid XML URI.\nsuggestedPrefix - The suggested prefix to be used if the URI is not yet\n            registered. Must be a valid XML name.\nReturns:\nReturns the registered prefix for this URI, is equal to the\n         suggestedPrefix if the namespace hasn't been registered before,\n         otherwise the existing prefix.\nThrows:\nXMPException - If the parameters are not accordingly set\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/XMPSchemaRegistry.html

XMPSchemaRegistry findAlias	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nfindAlias\nXMPAliasInfo findAlias(String qname)\nSearches for registered aliases.\n\nParameters:\nqname - an XML conform qname\nReturns:\nReturns if an alias definition for the given qname to another\n         schema and property is registered.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/XMPSchemaRegistry.html
XMPSchemaRegistry	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The schema registry keeps track of all namespaces and aliases used in the XMP\n metadata. At initialisation time, the default namespaces and default aliases\n are automatically registered. Namespaces must be registered before\n used in namespace URI parameters or path expressions. Within the XMP Toolkit\n the registered namespace URIs and prefixes must be unique. Additional\n namespaces encountered when parsing RDF are automatically registered. The\n namespace URI should always end in an XML name separator such as '/' or '#'.\n This is because some forms of RDF shorthand catenate a namespace URI with an\n element name to form a new URI.\n \nAliases in XMP serve the same purpose as Windows file shortcuts,\n Macintosh file aliases, or UNIX file symbolic links. The aliases are simply\n multiple names for the same property. One distinction of XMP aliases is that\n they are ordered, there is an alias name pointing to an actual name. The\n primary significance of the actual name is that it is the preferred name for\n output, generally the most widely recognized name.\n \n The names that can be aliased in XMP are restricted. The alias must be a top\n level property name, not a field within a structure or an element within an\n array. The actual may be a top level property name, the first element within\n a top level array, or the default element in an alt-text array. This does not\n mean the alias can only be a simple property. It is OK to alias a top level\n structure or array to an identical top level structure or array, or to the\n first item of an array of structures.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/XMPSchemaRegistry.html
XMPSchemaRegistryImpl registerNamespace	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nregisterNamespace\npublic String registerNamespace(String namespaceURI,\n                                String suggestedPrefix)\n                         throws XMPException\nDescription copied from interface: XMPSchemaRegistry\nRegister a namespace URI with a suggested prefix. It is not an error if\n the URI is already registered, no matter what the prefix is. If the URI\n is not registered but the suggested prefix is in use, a unique prefix is\n created from the suggested one. The actual registeed prefix is always\n returned. The function result tells if the registered prefix is the\n suggested one.\n \n Note: No checking is presently done on either the URI or the prefix.\n\nSpecified by:\nregisterNamespace in interface XMPSchemaRegistry\nParameters:\nnamespaceURI - The URI for the namespace. Must be a valid XML URI.\nsuggestedPrefix - The suggested prefix to be used if the URI is not yet\n            registered. Must be a valid XML name.\nReturns:\nReturns the registered prefix for this URI, is equal to the\n         suggestedPrefix if the namespace hasn't been registered before,\n         otherwise the existing prefix.\nThrows:\nXMPException - If the parameters are not accordingly set\nSee Also:\nXMPSchemaRegistry.registerNamespace(String, String)\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/XMPSchemaRegistryImpl.html

XMPUtils catenateArrayItems	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\ncatenateArrayItems\npublic static String catenateArrayItems(XMPMeta xmp,\n                                        String schemaNS,\n                                        String arrayName,\n                                        String separator,\n                                        String quotes,\n                                        boolean allowCommas)\n                                 throws XMPException\nCreate a single edit string from an array of strings.\n\nParameters:\nxmp - The XMP object containing the array to be catenated.\nschemaNS - The schema namespace URI for the array. Must not be null or\n            the empty string.\narrayName - The name of the array. May be a general path expression, must\n            not be null or the empty string. Each item in the array must\n            be a simple string value.\nseparator - The string to be used to separate the items in the catenated\n            string. Defaults to "; ", ASCII semicolon and space\n            (U+003B, U+0020).\nquotes - The characters to be used as quotes around array items that\n            contain a separator. Defaults to &apos;"&apos;\nallowCommas - Option flag to control the catenation.\nReturns:\nReturns the string containing the catenated array items.\nThrows:\nXMPException - Forwards the Exceptions from the metadata processing\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/XMPUtils.html
XMPUtils separateArrayItems	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nseparateArrayItems\npublic static void separateArrayItems(XMPMeta xmp,\n                                      String schemaNS,\n                                      String arrayName,\n                                      String catedStr,\n                                      PropertyOptions arrayOptions,\n                                      boolean preserveCommas)\n                               throws XMPException\nSeparate a single edit string into an array of strings.\n\nParameters:\nxmp - The XMP object containing the array to be updated.\nschemaNS - The schema namespace URI for the array. Must not be null or\n            the empty string.\narrayName - The name of the array. May be a general path expression, must\n            not be null or the empty string. Each item in the array must\n            be a simple string value.\ncatedStr - The string to be separated into the array items.\narrayOptions - Option flags to control the separation.\npreserveCommas - Flag if commas shall be preserved\nThrows:\nXMPException - Forwards the Exceptions from the metadata processing\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/XMPUtils.html
XMPUtils removeProperties	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nremoveProperties\npublic static void removeProperties(XMPMeta xmp,\n                                    String schemaNS,\n                                    String propName,\n                                    boolean doAllProperties,\n                                    boolean includeAliases)\n                             throws XMPException\nRemove multiple properties from an XMP object.\n \n RemoveProperties was created to support the File Info dialog's Delete\n button, and has been been generalized somewhat from those specific needs.\n It operates in one of three main modes depending on the schemaNS and\n propName parameters:\n \n \n Non-empty schemaNS and propName - The named property is\n removed if it is an external property, or if the \n flag doAllProperties option is true. It does not matter whether the\n named property is an actual property or an alias.\n \n  Non-empty schemaNS and empty propName - The all external\n properties in the named schema are removed. Internal properties are also\n removed if the flag doAllProperties option is set. In addition,\n aliases from the named schema will be removed if the flag includeAliases \n option is set.\n \n  Empty schemaNS and empty propName - All external properties in\n all schema are removed. Internal properties are also removed if the \n flag doAllProperties option is passed. Aliases are implicitly handled\n because the associated actuals are internal if the alias is.\n \n \n It is an error to pass an empty schemaNS and non-empty propName.\n\nParameters:\nxmp - The XMP object containing the properties to be removed.\nschemaNS - Optional schema namespace URI for the properties to be\n            removed.\npropName - Optional path expression for the property to be removed.\ndoAllProperties - Option flag to control the deletion: do internal properties in\n          addition to external properties.\nincludeAliases - Option flag to control the deletion: \n                        Include aliases in the "named schema" case above.\n                        Note: Currently not supported.\nThrows:\nXMPException - Forwards the Exceptions from the metadata processing\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/XMPUtils.html
XMPUtils appendProperties	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nappendProperties\npublic static void appendProperties(XMPMeta source,\n                                    XMPMeta dest,\n                                    boolean doAllProperties,\n                                    boolean replaceOldValues)\n                             throws XMPException\nAlias without the new option deleteEmptyValues.\n\nParameters:\nsource - The source XMP object.\ndest - The destination XMP object.\ndoAllProperties - Do internal properties in addition to external properties.\nreplaceOldValues - Replace the values of existing properties.\nThrows:\nXMPException - Forwards the Exceptions from the metadata processing\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/XMPUtils.html
XMPUtils appendProperties	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nappendProperties\npublic static void appendProperties(XMPMeta source,\n                                    XMPMeta dest,\n                                    boolean doAllProperties,\n                                    boolean replaceOldValues,\n                                    boolean deleteEmptyValues)\n                             throws XMPException\nAppend properties from one XMP object to another.\n \n XMPUtils#appendProperties was created to support the File Info dialog's Append button, and\n has been been generalized somewhat from those specific needs. It appends information from one\n XMP object (source) to another (dest). The default operation is to append only external\n properties that do not already exist in the destination. The flag \n doAllProperties can be used to operate on all properties, external and internal.\n The flag replaceOldValues option can be used to replace the values \n of existing properties. The notion of external\n versus internal applies only to top level properties. The keep-or-replace-old notion applies\n within structs and arrays as described below.\n \nIf replaceOldValues is true then the processing is restricted to the top \n level properties. The processed properties from the source (according to \n doAllProperties) are propagated to the destination, \n replacing any existing values.Properties in the destination that are not in the source \n are left alone.\n\n If replaceOldValues is not passed then the processing is more complicated. \n Top level properties are added to the destination if they do not already exist. \n If they do exist but differ in form (simple/struct/array) then the destination is left alone.\n If the forms match, simple properties are left unchanged while structs and arrays are merged.\n \n If deleteEmptyValues is passed then an empty value in the source XMP causes\n the corresponding destination XMP property to be deleted. The default is to treat empty \n values the same as non-empty values. An empty value is any of a simple empty string, an array\n with no items, or a struct with no fields. Qualifiers are ignored.\n \nThe detailed behavior is defined by the following pseudo-code:\n \n\n    appendProperties ( sourceXMP, destXMP, doAllProperties, \n                        replaceOldValues, deleteEmptyValues ):\n       for all source schema (top level namespaces):\n          for all top level properties in sourceSchema:\n             if doAllProperties or prop is external:\n                appendSubtree ( sourceNode, destSchema, replaceOldValues, deleteEmptyValues )\n \n    appendSubtree ( sourceNode, destParent, replaceOldValues, deleteEmptyValues ):\n        if deleteEmptyValues and source value is empty:\n            delete the corresponding child from destParent\n        else if sourceNode not in destParent (by name):\n           copy sourceNode's subtree to destParent\n        else if replaceOld:\n            delete subtree from destParent\n            copy sourceNode's subtree to destParent\n        else:\n            // Already exists in dest and not replacing, merge structs and arrays\n            if sourceNode and destNode forms differ:\n                return, leave the destNode alone\n            else if form is a struct:\n                for each field in sourceNode:\n                    AppendSubtree ( sourceNode.field, destNode, replaceOldValues )\n            else if form is an alt-text array:\n                copy new items by "xml:lang" value into the destination\n            else if form is an array:\n                copy new items by value into the destination, ignoring order and duplicates\n \n\nNote: appendProperties can be expensive if replaceOldValues is not passed and \n the XMP contains large arrays. The array item checking described above is n-squared. \n Each source item is checked to see if it already exists in the destination, \n without regard to order or duplicates.\n Simple items are compared by value and "xml:lang" qualifier, other qualifiers are ignored.\n Structs are recursively compared by field names, without regard to field order. Arrays are\n compared by recursively comparing all items.\n\nParameters:\nsource - The source XMP object.\ndest - The destination XMP object.\ndoAllProperties - Do internal properties in addition to external properties.\nreplaceOldValues - Replace the values of existing properties.\ndeleteEmptyValues - Delete destination values if source property is empty.\nThrows:\nXMPException - Forwards the Exceptions from the metadata processing\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/XMPUtils.html
XMPUtils convertToBoolean	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>\nconvertToBoolean\npublic static boolean convertToBoolean(String value)\n                                throws XMPException\nConvert from string to Boolean.\n\nParameters:\nvalue - The string representation of the Boolean.\nReturns:\nThe appropriate boolean value for the string. The checked values\n         for true and false are:\n         \nXMPConst.TRUESTR and XMPConst.FALSESTR\n"t" and "f"\n                    "on" and "off"\n                    "yes" and "no"\n                        "value <> 0" and "value == 0"\n         \nThrows:\nXMPException - If an empty string is passed.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/XMPUtils.html

The values used are\n         given by the constnts XMPConst.TRUESTR and\n         XMPConst.FALSESTR.\n\n</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/XMPUtils.html
